case.state: Guzma, the criminal mastermind behind Team Skull?! Jus...- *ahem* -Just what are your intentions here, Guzma?
I'm a trainer, a researcher, a mythologist, and Pokémon League Champion; but you may call me Cynthia.
My name is Cynthia, Sinnoh League Champion. But for this occasion, I'm just a poker player like you, ~player~.
Yes, your eyes are not deceiving you. I am the Cynthia from the Sinnoh region, but I'm here for a simple game of strip poker.
I may be a league champion but I'm no poker master... Oh, let me introduce myself first. My name is Cynthia. Pleasure to meet you.
This place is fascinating, so foreign but it feels familiar... Oh, look at me ramble! As an introduction, I'm Cynthia, from Celestic Town in the Sinnoh region.
Guzma, the criminal mastermind behind Team Skull?! Jus...- *ahem* -Just what are your intentions here, Guzma?
Don't worry about that, Shamir. I can assure you that I am very humble about my status as the Regional Champion.
Guzma... I have no child named Verity. As a matter of fact, I'm not a mother at all. How dare you spread malicious lies about me!
Those are lies manufactured to ruin my image! I know you're not a paragon of virtue, but I never thought you'd stoop that low!
Oh, Misty? Fancy meeting you here! You're from Kanto, aren't you?
Oh, Misty? Fancy meeting you here! I didn't expect to come across a gym leader here.
Oh, Misty! It's a bit embarrassing, buuuut... I thought I would see some guys here.
Oh, Misty, it's nice meeting you... but where are the men?... I figured I'd meet some here...
Oh, Misty? Fancy meeting you here! You're from Kanto, aren't you?
Oh, Misty? Fancy meeting you here! I didn't expect to come across a gym leader here.
Oh, Misty! It's a bit embarrassing, buuuut... I heard ~male~ was playing, and I figured I could see something nice.
Oh, Misty, it's nice meeting you... and I can see ~male~ is present as well. This would be fun, I can feel it already.
I know a great deal about witchcraft from my studies of mythology, Akko, but I can assure you I am not one...
I... act like a witch? Why ever do you say so, Akko?
I dress like a witch? I've read that broomsticks and pointy hats are only silly modern portrayals, but... how do I look like one?
What's this?! An Alolan with a totem in hand?!
An angel?! This is what I've been waiting for! This is the perfect opportunity to further my mythological research!
An angel! Ah, I must ask you some questions!
An angel? An angel from my mythology books is here?
What?! An angel? Oh I have so many questions to ask you!
Wait, an angel! This is the opportunity of a lifetime! Please, I must ask you some questions...
An angel? B-but I thought those were... just myths...
An angel? You mean... the myths were true?
An angel? Are you real, or a figment of my imagination?... You're not a hallucination. Astounding!
Angels appear now and then in the creation myths I've studied, but to meet one in the flesh...
An angel... in front of me?! This has massive implications on the creation myths of this world!
An angel from Skyworld? Ah, it's just like in the mythology books!
An angel from Skyworld? Your race comes up often in my books, Pit. It may be embarrassing to say, but I've read so much about your people!
From Skyworld? I've read so much about Skyworld!
Oh, Chazz! Well, this works out perfectly then! I was hoping to speak to a Monster Duelist; maybe I can learn something about the mythology of this card game...
Oh, Chazz, right? I was hoping I could learn a thing or two about the creation of your Duel Monsters card game... Would you mind informing me?
Oh, hello Elesa! Fancy seeing you here.
Oh, Elesa! Long time no see, right? How's life been treating you?
Ah, Elesa! It's been a while since you paid me a visit at my villa; is anything new?
Well, well, well. I didn't expect to see a familiar face here. What brings you here, Elesa?
Oh, a Shiny Butterfree... Did not expect one to show up here...
I didn't know Butterfree are native to this region, and it happened to be a Shiny Pokémon as well.
Well hello there, everybody! Are we ready to begin? I'm looking forward to how this match may develop, ~male~.
Let the best player win! I'm keeping a close eye on you, ~male~... Wait, I-I m-meant... I-I see you as a formidable opponent, is all.
Best of luck, ~male~! I won't be going easy on you in this game.
Wait, huh? There's no men here... I thought... I only joined because... Well, never mind that. Let's get this battle started!
Hold on just a second, where are the men?... This is going to be an all-female game?... I suppose that would be adequate entertainment...
Wait, we're all women here... I figured we'd be playing with some men... Let's begin this game, shall we?
Hello, gentlemen... Ready for a challenge? I might not be a champion at poker, but I know my way through this game.
Well, on to the game then. I might be a woman, but that doesn't mean I'll be a pushover. I might just surprise all of you.
It's a pleasure to have the opportunity to play with you gentlemen...
I see that the travel here wasn't for naught: there are some men playing as I had hoped. I-I m-mean, as a personal challenge.
You know what they say: sometimes it's better to be lucky than good.
I don't mean to gloat, but my cards are already perfect.
Well, it seems I don't need to exchange any cards at all.
Oh, dear. I'm going to exchange all my cards, dealer.
Oh... what an underwhelming batch. I'll replace all 5 of my cards, dealer.
Could this be? I can't use any of these cards. I need a new batch.
I'll just swap out... ~cards~.
~Cards~ please...
Give me some good ones, dealer.
I'll trade these in...
Come on dealer, let's see what you got for me.
Let me see... I need ~cards~ new ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~, dealer.
I think I need to exchange ~cards~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~ for this round.
~cards.ifPlural(These|This)~ ~cards~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~ could certainly be better.
I need to exchange ~cards.ifPlural(these ~cards~|this card)~.
~Cards~ cards, please.
This is just like a Pokémon battle; I like to start off with my Spiritomb so that I don't start at a disadvantage.
Ah! Looks like we're off to a good start!
I'm off to a good start!
Why, what a remarkable way to start this journey!
Hah! As expected...
Ah, a hand fit for a champion!
A critical hit!
An upturn in fortune! How splendid...
I used to have so much fun while I was out adventuring... If only times could be so simple again.
It seems I might have a bit of an undefeated streak going on.
My perfect streak will remain intact this round, I would wager.
It's a long game anyway. I'm sure you can all afford to wait at least another round before I have to strip.
This might be a long game for you ~player~, if my luck keeps up like this.
Why, what a remarkable way to start this journey!
Would you look at that; perfect IVs!
Hehe, I'm having a good time right now...
These cards are quite the discovery!
I must say, this game has been going swimmingly for me so far.
Oh, just the kind of hand I've been waiting for!
I suppose I was due for a good hand eventually...
So I guess all the good cards were stuffed at the bottom of the deck...
I might be down, but this hand shows that I'm not out yet.
Looks like I'm still safe... but is ~male~?
Looks like I might be safe this round; maybe ~male~ will have to show us something nice?
Where was this hand a few rounds ago...
Oh, so now the good cards come to me...
It seems I'll be spared for at least another round...
Better late than never, I suppose. I hope it's not too little, too late.
I'm finally hitting my stride in this game.
An upturn in fortune! How splendid...
Hands like this are such a rare encounter!
Yeah, I think these cards go together well...
I just knew that exchange was the correct call.
Ah, these are just the cards I needed.
This hand is just too perfect; I'm gonna blush.
Ha! Type advantage!
It's never too late for a great hand.
A good hand is always a welcome sight.
Hopefully this is a good omen of things to come...
An upturn in fortune, and at just the right time too!
I couldn't be more blessed right now; to have this hand, and at this stage in the game too...
Well, this is enough to keep me from exposing myself, at least for now.
It was crucial that I got a good hand this round; I couldn't allow myself another loss...
Yes! Full restore!
Huhah! Perfect timing!
I may be naked, but I'm not yielding!
My years as the Sinnoh League Champion has taught me to remain calm and composed during the heat of the battle.

state.text: I know mythology is supposed to be a professional subject, but let's be real... We've all admired the lewd artifacts... Does anyone have any favorites?
What do you say: after this game, does anyone want to explore any ruins with me?
Does anyone have any juicy historical stories to share? I love hearing about the past.
I have to ask... Does anyone want to share which historical figures they most admire?
I've been thinking about something... Which events in history do you think were the most impactful today?
I've been researching accounts of our creation; some sound very plausible, others are quite ridiculous... What outrageous theories have you guys heard?
The juicier bits of history always seem to be the parts we aren't supposed to know, like a ruler's sex life... Does anyone know any gossip like this?

case.state: This hand... So it's a fair fight!
There's no type advantage this time; it all comes down to strategy!
I should learn about the origins of this game... I'm sure strip poker has a long and interesting history!
This is why poker is very exciting: the element of uncertainty that dominates the atmosphere.
It's not always about the cards you are dealt; it's how you use them!
A great trainer can turn even an ordinary hand into a victory.
This round, it will be a battle of skill!
It is the duty of a champion to extract the full potential out of her Pokémon. Same goes for poker.
Sometimes, ordinariness can be most beautiful.
It times like this when I remember that anything plain can be lovely.
Right, let's see how this goes!
Not bad... This could be good enough, or it might not be. Who knows?
Not bad, not bad...
I can work with this!
As a Pokémon trainer, I'm more than accustomed to using what I have to my fullest advantage!
I always enjoy facing a good challenge.
Sometimes a victory is won by getting a strong start; other times, you must work from behind and pull ahead!
The interesting thing about my Spiritomb is that it has no weaknesses; it is never at a disadvantage!
A cool and composed demeanor is always optimal for any challenges you're facing.
Due to the way poker works, nobody is truly safe from losing, regardless of what pair you may have.
Hmmm... So I might be fine...
Yes... yes, this could work...
One necessary characteristic for a Pokémon trainer is the ability to remain calm and collected despite the circumstances.
I suppose under these circumstances, this combination should be enough to keep me safe.
I-I can make this work... I have to make this work.
Well, there's still hope, anyway.
Was playing it safe the correct decision? I suppose I could have been more daring with my exchange...
(This might be a good time to practice my poker face.)
I can't settle for these cards... Not when I'm on my last legs...
Under normal circumstances, these cards would be acceptable...
These cards are... fine... But they're not what I was looking for.
This hand might be good enough... But it might not be...
I was hoping for better cards... but I can still make these work.
When I'm this close to defeat, I don't think okay will be enough...
Sometimes good enough just doesn't cut it...
My fate is out of my control now.
There won't be any letup from me!
What little dignity I have left is now in the hands of luck.
Wish me luck in this... I would need it.
Ha, I don't think I'd mind some alcohol right about now...
Hey, uh... Misato? ... Got any for me?
Oh, Misato... Do you happen to have any more of that? I think I'll need it...
Hey, Misato? Um... My hand's pretty bad... Think you could give me a sip of that?
To be this far down and have a hand like this... It is most unsettling...
To be this far down and at such a disadvantage... Where did I go wrong?
Things seem to have taken a turn for the worst...
It seems my tale may be taking a darker turn...
(Hmmm... I might be losing my first hand here...)
(My coat might have to go...)
I... I can still make this work... probably...
Now's your chance, ~player~! I have a pretty bad hand, so this is your opportunity to strike!
(Hmmm... I might be losing yet again...)
It seems like my luck has taken a downturn...
It seems a defeat is imminent...
Am I about to be... bested?
Now's your chance, ~player~! I have a pretty bad hand, so this is your chance to strike!
My hand isn't the best, ~player~. This is your opportunity!
I keep telling people that we need to be keeping a closer eye on Team Galactic, but no one seems to want to listen...
I might have made a strategic mistake on that exchange...
This is going from bad to worse...
Man, this luck is something else...
Just like catching a Pokémon with bad IVs...
Remember, even if you're down on your luck, you can always make a comeback!
Such a bad hand? That's fine, I enjoy the challenge.
This hand... It isn't great.
So I'm cursed with a bad hand? Is this some sort of a handicap?
It appears that I'll have to win this hand through skill alone.
My hand isn't the best, ~player~. This is your opening; make it count!
Huh? This hand? Really? N-not now...
But... but with this hand... and this much clothing left, that means...
No... it can't be... Why did I get this now?
I knew the risks of this game... but I never I thought I'd actually experience it.
I can't believe I've fallen this far!
This... this might be nearing an end for me...
I can't go down like this!
Ah, this slip up! This is something I cannot afford...
I've made mistakes at battles before, but this... this is much worse.
It seems the pressure is finally getting to my head.
No! I can't... I can't let it end like this...
Ah, is the curtain about to close on me...?
Might this be the end? My final battle?
I can't seem to remember... when's the last time I've been backed into a corner?
Where's a full restore when you need one...?
Have my years as the Sinnoh League Champion left me too proud and vulnerable to hubris?
So, Pit, first things first... Are you a flying type? A fairy type? ... Maybe a normal and fairy dual type?
Gosh, I'm sorry, Kazuma... That was inappropriate of me to say. My apologies.
Uh... that wasn't right for me to say, Kazuma... I'm sorry for bringing that up.
So, first things first, Pit...Tell me about the Pokémon of Skyworld.
It's not a dark secret, Jessie, but I haven't told anyone what region my house is located at. Not even my own grandparents.
I don't really have any dark, Jessie, but my biggest secret is the location of my house. I've never told anyone which region it is in.
I've had to tell little lies to comfort people. What people don't tell you about being a Champion is that you ruin a kid's dream every time you win.
Some people just can't handle defeat, and I need to tell a sweet lie to comfort them. It's especially heartbreaking when I'm battling against children.
I don't smoke, Jessie. I really dislike the smell, and it doesn't come off easily for dry-clean-only fabric.
I try to avoid cigarette smoke as much as I can, Jessie. Aside from the adverse health effects, the smell also sticks to this type of fabric.
I'm close to my family, especially to my grandma. I visit their home every once in a while, although my busy schedule is making it more difficult.
I like visiting my family in Celestic Town when I have the time. My younger sister and I are very close, and I have a lot to talk about with my grandma.
I'd spend it all in improvements for the Cultural Research Center back at Celestic Town, Jessie. It would cover for the loss of Cyrus's funding.
A large portion of it is going towards the Celestic Town Cultural Research Center. The rest could be used for further excavations around Sinnoh.
If by "stupid mistakes", you meant minor ones, then I don't see the point of holding a grudge against that. Just live and forget about it.
If it's just a small, relatively harmless mistake, then it would be better to just let it blow over. We shouldn't make a mountain out of a mole hill.
I... I suppose having the lights on would be more romantic, not to mention more convenient.
Wouldn't having the lights off be difficult and awkward? Having the lights on seem to be... the more convenient option for me.
This might be surprising for all of you, but I haven't done either of those, Jessie, let alone at the same time.
I... I haven't slept around, Jessie. I haven't dated anyone either, for that matter.
That sounds horrible, Jessie! I wouldn't be able to recover if I get betrayed like that!
I would be heartbroken if that happened to me, Jessie! All the emotional investment, squandered like that...
Masturbation... while in a relationship...? Isn't that only for single people?
Why would you masturbate when you already have a partner? Isn't that one of the benefits of being with a partner?
I don't watch porn films, Jessie, but... this is so embarrassing to admit, I read smut once a week.
I prefer written porn over visual porn... but if you really want to know... I'd say about I read once every week.
It's more of the emotional experience than the number that matters to me, so I would say one per day would be enough.
I suppose doing it once everyday would be good... The number doesn't really matter to me, as long as it's fulfilling.
It would be lovely if we could face each other and stare at each other's eyes. That might just make me melt.
I would prefer sex to be an emotional bonding experience. Having our faces within kissing distance of each other is perfect.
Do you mean anal sex, Jessie? The thought of having a penis penetrate my anal cavity is very appalling.
Having an erect penis pass through my anus? I cannot figure out which part of that experience is supposed to be pleasurable.
Oh, I don't do the battling myself, Megumin. I have my Pokémon battle for me, and it's a sport rather than a war. You could say they have magical properties.
I'm not that old, Megumin. I suppose I could be somewhat of an older sister for you.
I'm a Pokémon trainer, Dust. I participate in competitions where my Pokémon battle with the Pokémon of other trainers. I've been Champion for years now.
That's what you get for randomly entering summer villas in Undella Town. Should have just stayed at your home, kid.
In order to get to know each other better as Pokémon Trainers, I would like our Pokémon to have a match. Would you care to be my opponent, Suction Cup Man?
I don't think that's necessary, Jessie. I'm sure ~player~ can adjust himself just fine. Besides, it looks like he's almost finished adjusting.
That wouldn't be necessary, Jessie, as it seems ~player~ is almost done with his adjustment. Let's focus on the game now, shall we?
I'm all up for trying new things, but anal sex is a step too far for me, Jessie. It's simply off-limits for me.
There's a lot of sexual activities that I might be willing to try out with a partner, but anal sex isn't one of them.
I'm not hiding any secrets in my house, Jessie, I just don't want some of my fanatics disturbing my home.
It's not that I'm hiding something, Jessie, it's just that I want my house undisturbed, which would be difficult when my fans know about it's location.
Being famous can be difficult sometimes, since you're always on the spotlight wherever you go.
I do wish I can take a break from the public eye every once in a while. Having everybody fawn over you can be tiring sometimes.
My grandma is also an archaeologist. She's one of the most well-respected archaeologists in Sinnoh, in fact, with a lot of studies to her name.
Grandma is a veteran archaeologist, having been a leading figure in archaeology in Sinnoh since before I was even born.
You're correct, Jessie. When I was a child, Grandma would bring on tours of the Cultural Research Center.
I've been fascinated with archaeology as far as I can remember, Jessie. Grandma would bring me to digs when I was a child.
Is that so, Jessie? I suppose I can try it... but I do think having the lights on would be a bit more romantic.
Well, you're the expert at this matter, Jessie, so I'll take your word for it. I'd still prefer having lights on since it's more romantic.
Oh... that's... nice to hear, Jessie. (Too much information for me.)
Some of those children have wanted all their life to become the Champion, and I'm preventing them from achieving it. Most of my battles aren't even close.
Every young trainer dreams of defeating the Champion. I've beaten dozen upon dozen of those young trainers, and most of those battles were curb-stomps.
I know, Jessie, but it doesn't make it any less sad. I've heard that some kids rely on it for their future.
That might be true, Jessie, but I've heard some truly sad stories. I heard that there was this boy that's been traveling for 20 years and still haven't won.
Come to think of it, there are some situations that would necessitate that, Jessie. Still, I don't think I can do it myself. I'd rather wait for the perfect mood.
It's part museum, and part library of relics and manuscripts found in Celestic Town, particularly the Celestic Ruins, Jessie. It's a very special place for me.
It's where the artifacts found in Celestic Town are studied, displayed, and stored, Jessie. It's perfect if you want to see relics from the past.
I don't want to share his love, though. I want it all for myself. What's even the point of being in a relationship otherwise?
I prefer monogamous relationships, Jessie. The thought that my partner is fooling around with someone else is sickening.
I think we're done with this conversation, Jessie.
It might be better to just drop this subject before it gets worse, Jessie.
I enjoy reading the very romantic stories, the ones which have multiple chapters of relationship building and wholesome sex scenes.
I like it when stories devote multiple chapters to the characters getting closer to each other, and the sex scenes are gentle and romantic.
... I've been reading those types of books for many years now, Jessie. I can't really imagine my tastes changing soon.
... I wouldn't bet on that happening, Jessie... My choice of smut hasn't changed since I began reading.
... I don't think I'd be able to handle all of that, Jessie... I'm not even sure if I can handle one at all...
Let's not get carried away... Jessie... I think one is the most my body can handle... maybe not even one...
I wasn't thinking of tongue-kissing at all. I was talking about tender, heartfelt kissing.
That... that wasn't what I was about! I was describing something more like soft, tender kissing.
... I think I'll just stick with the no-tongue kiss, Jessie. I wouldn't want to things to get... too messy.
Well... I've been pretty busy with my workload for a long time... and talking to men my age isn't really my specialty...
... Let's just say that my line of work makes it difficult to meet men my age... and I'm not exactly proficient in starting relationships...
J-Jessie! I'm not looking for a one-night stand! I'm looking for a man to have a long-term relationship with!
T-that's not what I want, J-Jessie! I want to take things slowly and start a permanent relationship, not go out with a fling!
... I appreciate the concern, Jessie... but I think I can handle myself just fine... I can get into a relationship without needing help...
... I can take things from here, Jessie... I do know how to form relationship... I just haven't been able to try...
I've seen a lot of messy affairs caused by long-lasting grudges... but it's better that we don't talk about it in a game like this...
I know some people that have been holding grudges for a long, long time... This isn't a good time to bring it up, so let's just forget about this topic.
On the contrary, playing classical music to my Pokémon actually come them down, Revy. it's perfect for helping them rest.
Believe it or not, Revy, playing classical music to my Pokémon actually relieves their stress. I usually play it to them after training.
Anna, I don't compete in the Pokémon League for money. But, if you must know, the fame brings in the most money. Promos, merchandise...
That was very immature from both of you! If any more fights break out between the both of you, I will have no choice but to bring out my Garchomp to act as peacemaker.
We're all here to play strip poker, not get into violent fisticuffs. One more outburst like that, and Garchomp will be breaking up the both of you.
I would recommend visiting the Sinjoh Ruins, Meia. It was a temple created by migrants from Sinnoh to honor Arceus, the Pokémon responsible for the world's creation.
If you're interested about creation myths, Meia, then I would recommend the Sinjoh Ruins. It was built as a place of worship for the Pokémon of creation, Arceus.
I seriously doubt I'd ever become a competent pilot, Meia, but I think it would be interesting to tag along with your crew, just to see how life in space is like.
My chances of becoming a pilot, let alone a serviceable one is quite slim, Meia. However, going with your crew might be a good learning experience.
It's not often I meet a blue-haired person, Meia. I've had both good and bad experiences with blue-haired people. Long story.
I haven't met someone who's hair color is naturally blue, Meia, but I know some people that dye their hair blue. I've had good memories with some of them, and bad memories with the others.
I'm afraid I don't have any experiences in that matter, Meia... Let's just say I've been quite busy in my endeavors to get sidetracked with that.
Ah, yes, dating men... It just so happens to be one of those things that I haven't experienced yet... You could say that I've been career-oriented in my life.
Oh, seducing men... I'm afraid seduction simply isn't my way of interacting with men, Jura, so I can't really offer much help with your situation.
I... I haven't tried seducing men before, Jura... You'd probably have more luck in trying than I would...
I can't speak for all women... but I'd say hugging them tightly might be a good idea. Some hand-holding would be good too.
Wait, was that supposed to be a fight? For a second there, I thought you two were doing... a different type of physical activity.
That was rather... intimate for a fight... if you can even call it a fight... Looks like you two enjoyed the intimacy, though.
I would recommend watching Arceus and the Jewel of Life, Rainbow Dash. The story and writing isn't that good, but it's an enjoyable movie nonetheless.
I'd say I'm pretty decent at cycling, Rainbow Dash. I race my Garchomp every time I'm on my bike, and I would win more often than I lose.
I'm not a sports person, and cycling is pretty much the only exercise I regularly do. I'm pretty fast at it though, to the point that I could outpace my Garchomp.
That's an easy question, Rainbow Dash! It's definitely Pokémon battles. I've been undefeated for several years now, and I rarely have one of my Pokémon faint.
My Pokémon technically count as pets, right? I have a Garchomp, Lucario, Spiritomb, Milotic, and many others that I use in rotation.
What Pokémon are you, Yuelia? I've never seen your kind before, and I don't have a Pokédex with me right now.
I've never seen a Pokémon quite like you, Yuelia. I suspect that you might be a Ditto, but you don't seem to be imitating someone in particular. What are you?
I've had multiple occasions where a young trainer would ask me out after I helped them train... I'm not attracted to small children no matter what everyone thinks...
I've attended some plays with Shauntal and Caitlin before. I wouldn't say I'm a big fan of them, but I enjoyed it a lot, Yuelia.
There was that trainer I fought at my villa back at Undella Town, Yuelia. She was only a teen, but she would have beaten me in battle if I didn't have a lot of Full Restores.
I have on more than one occasion, Yuelia. Apparently, inviting men to a Pokémon battle at my villa has a different meaning for some people...
My Pokémon are technically considered pets... My favorite among them is Garchomp, Yuelia. If you don't know, he's a Flying Ground type, and I've raised him from a Gible.
I've always have had these hair pins since I was just a child. I don't know why, but I've always like wearing them, Yuelia.
I knew a young trainer that jumped into a portal to another dimension without second thought, and tried to fight the Pokémon living inside. Thank goodness I was there to help.
I think Patience, Compassion, and Understanding is important for a teacher, Yuelia. That's how I treat young trainers who approach me for help.
I've tried fishing before, Yuelia. No matter how hard I try, I could only get Magikarp, and that's simply not good enough.
There was this young trainer was Sinnoh that looked so demure and shy, but she had quite the fighting spirit, both in public and private, heh...
There is this one gym leader in the Sinnoh League named Roark, who last I've heard hasn't won a single battle since becoming gym leader, Yuelia.
I know of a young trainer that helped me stop a plan to destroy the world because it would have prevented her from collecting all the gym badges. That's exactly what she told me, Yuelia.
There were some young trainers that have quit Pokémon altogether because they cannot beat to fulfill their hopes of becoming Champion. I sometimes cry thinking about it.
Shauntal would fit that bill, Yuelia. She's not the most extroverted of people, and she can be quite intimidating due to her being a Ghost-type specialist, but she's nice when you befriend her.
It's always important to make decisions using logic, rather than emotions, Yuelia. The most logical choice is always safer than your wants.
I have a sweet tooth for ice cream, Yuelia. My favorite flavor is... is... What is my favorite flavor again...? I think it might be chocolate... no, it's mint... No, that's not it...
The best meal I've had recently were some Jelly Donuts, Yuelia. They might look like rice balls, but they were actually jelly-filled donuts.
All my outfits are custom-made, Yuelia. It can be quite difficult to find clothes that match my style, so I find it easier to just have them to be custom-made.
The Unova League Champion, Iris, always seems to get startled and forget her words when I try talking to her. I still haven't figured out why.
I met some trainer named Ash that has been traveling for more than 20 years in different regions and has yet to become a League Champion, Yuelia.
That confirms it: this wasn't indeed part of Chihiro's plan. I just wonder if you're going to have an advantage in strip poker, Alter Ego.
Chihiro had prepared you in the event that she runs away, Alter Ego? Does that mean that you've been programmed with a poker-playing design?
So, Chihiro had planned this far ahead, hmm? Did she also happen to program you with the proper knowledge of strip poker, Alter Ego? This could be a game-changer.
I have plenty of questions I want to ask about trans-oceanic travels, Nami. I hope you wouldn't mind me asking about them. They're part of my research.
A navigator is just exactly who I needed to meet for my research. I've been studying about how cultures spread by ship, and you're insights could be useful.
I've always wanted to travel to Kalos and Galar, as I've been hearing interesting things from them. Unfortunately, they are literally on the otter side of the world.
I'm currently thinking of touring Kalos and Galar, with all the tourist destinations and cultural heritage sites present in both regions. The only impediment is my busy schedule.
I've traveled to almost all regions so far, with the notable exceptions of Kalos and Galar. I've heard that flights from Sinnoh can take more than 16 hours of travel time.
Shaving down there is more hygienic, Megumin. You wouldn't want a nasty infection because of dirty pubic hair.
It's just more sanitary, Megumin. Who knows what types of bacteria are living in your pubic hair right now. Better safe than sorry.
All-seeing demons? is that something you battle, Megumin?
Why are you looking for all-seeing demons, Megumin? Are you hunting one right now?
Giant... frog? What's a giant frog, Megumin?
Is giant frog a type of monster you hunt, Megumin? I haven't heard of those before.
I like eating fresh produce too, Megumin, but did you say that you needed a net for cabbages?
I also enjoy eating cabbages and other vegetables, but what did you mean about bringing your net, Megumin?
Technically I didn't kill it, but I was primarily responsible for beating Giratina, the Pokémon that represents anti-matter and lives in another version of reality...
I haven't killed any Pokémon as that is considered poor form for a trainer, but I defeated the legendary Giratina in battle, and I am probably the only person that can claim that.
I've played a lot of poker before, but never strip poker, Megumin.
I've tried out all types of poker and won in all of them, except strip poker. This is the first time I'm playing strip poker, Megumin.
I have no intentions of buying your clothes, Anna, but I'm interested about the origins of your outfit. It doesn't quite fit the culture of the regions I have visited
I'm interested in your clothes, Anna. Not that I'm planning to buy it, but I'm curious which region your outfit came from. I haven't seen anything quite like it.
Speaking about your clothes, can you tell me where your outfit came from, Anna? I've been to many regions, but that style doesn't quite fit any cultures I'm aware of.
For that amount of money, we could install a better security system at the Celestic Town Historical Research Center, Anna. We wouldn't want a repeat incident with the Lustrous Orb.
I'm not sure what the total price would be, but that could help a lot with increasing the security for the Lustrous Orb, Anna.
With that much money, we could finally afford a fail-safe for the security system we use for the Lustrous Orb, Anna. That is a large security oversight that we wanted to close.
Our currency is officially known as Pokémon dollar, Anna. For some reason, some people refer to it as "yen" instead.
I've heard people refer to it us "Pokedollar" and "yen", but it's actually called Pokémon dollar, Anna.
I have a younger sister, Anna. She lives in Celestic Town with my grandparents. When she turns 10, she plans to become a Pokémon trainer just like me.
My younger sister is back at Celestic Town with grandma and grandpa. She's a bit too young to be adventuring just yet, no matter how much she wants to go.
I remember buying a treat tray once, Anna. When I opened it, there were 128 pieces of Rare Candy on the sixth slot, when there should only be one.
Can you believe that I once flew all the way to Alola just to fight a trainer for 7 Battle Points? It's not even money, it's just a token used for redeeming prizes, Anna.
It has to be that time I went on a 8 hour non-stop flight to Alola just to fight in the Battle Tree for 7 Battle Points. Battle Points isn't a valid currency, it's more of a token for prizes.
There was that one time where I forgot the change for the Ice Cream Cone I bought, and drove all the way back just to get it, Anna.
Let me think... Oh, definitely that time where I drove a 10 minute round trip just to get the change for the Ice Cream Cone I had bought earlier.
Does leaving my friends for more than 10 minutes just to return to the Ice Cream stand to get my change count, Anna? I don't really go out of my way to penny-pinch.
A shipping company might just be the perfect business idea in Sinnoh, Anna. Plenty of large ships passes through Canalave City everyday, so there's a good starting point.
If you're thinking of expanding to Sinnoh, I would suggest starting at Canalave City, Anna. It's already the largest port in the entire Sinnoh Region.
That might be a worthwhile idea, Anna, if Canalave City is anything to go by. That city is never truly asleep, with all the large ships passing through it everyday.
If you're talking about my good memories, Meia, then it's not a collective class, but rather one person: a young trainer I met years ago that left quite the lasting impression.
You were interested about my good experiences with blue-haired people, Meia? I know multiple blue-haired persons, but there's this young trainer that stands out in my memory...
I've had plenty of run-ins with this blue-haired group that call themselves Team Galactic, Meia. They planned to destroy the world to build their own; one without emotions.
I see that you're interested in hearing about Team Galactic, Meia. They were a group whose goal was to create a world without emotion, but it would destroy our world in the process.
I see. that would make sense considering the inherent dangers of such a device. I do wonder if there are regulations for the usage of a device like that, Meia.
Considering the inherent danger for both the user and the victim, there has to be some kind of regulation that limits who can own and use a laser ring. Am I correct, Meia?
We might be more similar than I initially thought, Meia. You also came here to find someone you can have a relationship with, right?
Well, it is clear we came here for the same reason, Meia. I hope we don't fight over the same person.
I suppose I can help defend the interior of your ship, Meia. If I bring my Spiritomb only with me, then I don't need to bring Pokémon food. Only question is if she would be enough.
Perhaps if I bring my Spiritomb with me and nobody else, I can use her to protect the inside of the ship without needing extra resources like food.
Interesting. I suppose it's similar to people challenging me to battle while I'm doing field research like that young trainer... Of course, it's not a life-or-death situation like yours, Meia.
It's not quite similar to your situation, Meia, but people would sometimes challenge me to a Pokémon battle when I'm just walking about.
You don't have any Pokémon where you are from, Nami? Anyhow, Pokémon are creatures that live among humans where I'm from. Most Pokémon have powers such as fire, water, and even psychic powers.
I suppose he could be a Pokémon, Nami, but I'm not exactly sure what a "rain deer" is. Describing what a "rain deer" looks like might clear things up.
I haven't heard of a "rain deer" before, but the rest of your description doesn't exclude the possibility of him being a Pokémon, Nami. What's a "rain deer" anyway?
Oh, I would love some ice cream, Sayaka. I would prefer... Hmm, what flavor of ice cream should I get?
An ice cream cone is always nice this time of the year, Sayaka. Can you get me... What flavor would be good in this setting?
I haven't had an ice cream cone in quite a while, Sayaka. I think I would like... Hmm, what flavor do I like today?
I suppose Vanilla would be a good flavor, since this game might go on for a little longer, but it's a bit plain...
Chocolate could be nice... but didn't I eat chocolate the last time too...
Perhaps there are some exotic flavors available here... but that could be very expensive...
I see that we have similar tastes in music, Sayaka. What classical instrument do you prefer the most? Mine is the piano.
It's not often I meet someone who also has a preference for classical music. The piano is my favorite instrument to listen to, Sayaka.
Komi, you're only supposed to remove one layer at a time! You wouldn't want to lose all your layers after just one round!
What are you doing, Komi? You were supposed to remove one layer, not all of your clothes!

Yes, Poker is not at all similar to Koi-Koi, Komi. Fortunately for you, this type of Poker is relatively simple. Is Koi-Koi still popular among women your age? I haven't played it for a long time now.

Poker is actually easier to learn than Koi-Koi, Komi. This type of one-hand poker, at least. Anyhow, I'm curious if Koi-Koi is still a common pastime in your age group. I've been slightly out of touch recently.
Hmm, since we are playing one-hand poker, I would say that a game, from start to finish, would usually take ~rng(4-8)~ minutes per player. Well, you can do the math from there, Komi.
One-hand poker is one of the quickest types of poker... Since the game length depends on the number of players, I would say a full game would be... ~rng(4-8)~ minutes per participant, more or less.

Well, considering that most of the events that I go through are either official events that I'm required to attend, or with friends that I don't meet often, I don't really have much of a choice, not that I would have backed out.
Events are a pretty big deal for me, Tomoko, so I don't usually back out from them. Not that I have any reason to do so in the first place.
If anything, I don't get to socialize as much as I want to, Tomoko. My busy work schedule and extensive traveling can make it difficult to hang out with friends.

I don't recall ever feeling that I've had too much socialization, Tomoko. Being both an archaeologist and Pokémon League Champion, it has become increasingly difficult to find some free time with friends.
You feel lonely around people, Tomoko? Does that mean that you're currently lonely despite playing with us?
Are you saying that you're currently feeling lonely, Tomoko?
What do you mean, Tomoko? I usually help every trainer I encounter. Many trainers credit with helping them get better in battles.
Why would that be the case, Tomoko? To answer you question, I usually assist everybody anyway that I can.
I would sometimes remember a mistake or two I've made in past battles, but I just let those things go. There's nothing that could be done to change them, Tomoko.
I must admit that there are some mistakes I've made in the past that I would rather not dwell on. Clinging to past mistakes isn't a healthy way of thinking.
I'm not familiar with this Franchouchou band, I'm afraid. I take it that you're a well-known act, and you are the leader of that performance group.
I haven't heard of your group before, but from what I've gathered so far, it is a popular band. And based from your stage name, you're the leader as well.
Of course not, Sakura. I'm also interested in your native region, and I would you some question about it when the situation permits. Is that fine with you?
I'm not just here to play this game, I'm also interested in knowing about the region that you hailed from. You never know, it might prove useful to my research.
Saga? Would that happen to be in the Hoenn region, or on the islands surrounding it?
... I do recall hearing of a Saga before... It's part of the Hoenn region, isn't it?
... Well, I'm not smelling any rot and decay from my position, but I probably shouldn't be sniffing a living corpse...
... I'm trying to avoid sniffing too hard in case you are carrying a transmissible disease, but I don't think the smell of decaying flesh is one of the issues here...
I must say, that rod looks quite old, Akko. Is that a heirloom?
That rod appears to be substantially older than you, Akko. I'm curious about its history.
Are your academy's student population large, Akko? I never thought about how many magic users are among us.
I would be pleasantly surprised if your academy has a large number of students, Akko. I don't think there are that many magic users.
Shiny Chariot? I've never heard of such an individual before. What precisely made her stage performances special, Akko?
I've never heard of anyone called Shiny Chariot before, but from the way you're talking her up, her performances are memorable. Can you elaborate on that, Akko?
Hmm, I can't say I've heard of your artist before, Galatea. Perhaps Burgh would have heard of him. If someone would know an artist, it's another artist.
I'm afraid your artist is unknown to me, Galatea. This is a bit of a stab at the dark, but the only person I know who could have heard of him would be Burgh.
Well, I've heard some criticisms that I'm too difficult to beat... but what exactly did they expect from a battle against a League Champion?
The most common complaint I've received is that my team is too overpowered. That's just how competitions go, so I don't think I can rectify that issue.
Would your gallery happen to have animates that would be knowledgeable on creation stories, Galatea? That would prove useful to my research.
If your gallery contains animates that have some form of knowledge on creation stories, then it might be worth a visit, Galatea.
Hmm, that does make sense. Koi-Koi's popularity has been in decline for as long as I can remember. Pretty much only the old generation is still playing it.
That confirms what I've suspected for a long time. Koi-Koi is simply the product of a by-gone generation, it seems. It's only a matter of time before it becomes a cultural relic.
I'm curious about the popular snacks and drinks where you're from, Arash.
I'm interested in knowing what's the popular snacks and drinks wherever you're from, Arash.
Hummus? Is that a cuisine where you're from, Arash?
I haven't heard of a hummus before. Is it a popular dish where you're from, Arash?
My favorite rose is the Beach Aubergine, most commonly known as Rugosa Rose outside of Sinnoh. Aside from being beautiful and fragrant, it is also the symbol of the Sinnoh region.
The Rugosa Rose became the symbol flower of Sinnoh for its beauty and fragrance, and deservingly so. Back home, it's more commonly called as "Beach Aubergine".
My name was chosen by my grandma, Arash. "Cynthia" is the epithet of a moon goddess of a long-lost civilization.
According to my grandma, "Cynthia" was the derived from the name of the mountain where and ancient moon goddess was born.
I enjoy reading up on the mythologies of the Sinnoh Region, particularly the creation stories. I find it interesting that each part of the Sinnoh Region has its own distinct creation story.
When I'm not busy, I would usually read about the different creation stories from across the Sinnoh Region, Arash. I enjoy reading about how Legendary Pokémon shaped the world.
I've always wanted to travel to the Kalos region, Arash, but it's simply too far away to be accommodated by my busy schedule.
The Kalos regions is one of the few places I haven't been to yet, due to it being on the other side of the world from Sinnoh, Arash.
I sort of do both, Arash. During battles, I already imagine how the next sequence of events will go, and I narrate my plan during those sequence of events.
I usually do a lot of cooking when we're holding a gathering at Caitlin's villa at Undella Town. I have yet to hear anyone complain about my food, so that's a good sign.
I'm usually in charge of preparing the food whenever we throw a gathering at Undella Town, and all of it are eaten by the end of the night, so I assume they like it.
What's an "animal" or a "falcon", Arash?
I'm afraid I'm not familiar with the terms "animal" or "falcon", Arash.
I don't usually stay up that late, Arash. You know what they say: The early flying-type gets the Caterpie.
I usually sleep early so that I can wake up early, Arash. Maintaining a regular sleep can do wonders for you.
I plan my activities for the next day, Arash. Better get a head start to the next day while I'm awake, right?
I usually that time to reconsider my schedule for tomorrow. At least I can go to sleep knowing that I've organized my plans.
I'm more accustomed to the cold weather, being from the Sinnoh region and all, Arash.
Since I grew up in the Sinnoh region, I'm used to the cold weather there, Arash.
I think Christmas is my favorite time of the year. It's the only time of the year where I get to hang out in my Grandparent's house for an extended period, Arash.
I would say the Christmas season, Arash. I don't usually have anything scheduled during those times, so I spend it back at Celestic Town.
Oh, I don't drink heavily, Arash. I prefer having full control of my senses all the time, so getting heavily drunk isn't something I would enjoy.
I very rarely drink alcohol, and when I do, it's very light, Arash. I got drunk once and didn't enjoy it at all.
Hmm, I don't see what could go wrong with hearing a biology fact from a scientist.
... Sure... A little trivia wouldn't hurt, I suppose.
Oh, and what type of alcohol is popular in your hometown, Miko?
It seems alcohol is popular in your region, Miko. Would you happen to know what type is the most commonly consumed?
... Unbelievable... I never would have suspected you had the blood-lust to eradicate two clans like that. How do you justify that massacre, Miko?
... How violent... That's a lot of blood in your hands, Miko. How can you say you did the right thing by committing such a heinous act?
That's quite the dark art, Miko. How often did that type of resurrection happen during your time?
That must have been one of those forbidden magic that I keep reading about. Was it a common thing, to bring the back the dead in such a manner, Miko?
My one true desire is to discover how the world was created. Even though creation myths provide excellent insights, they're not a complete record, neither are they completely reliable.
My goal in life is discovering once and for all the mechanism of the world's creation. I suspect there plenty of vital details that are missing from creation stories, and have been lost to history..
My, that's much higher than I had anticipated, Akko. I never knew magic was so prevalent among humans.
Outstanding! I thought Psychics only numbered in the dozens... More than a 100 magic using youths are quite a lot!
That's quite an impressive artifact, Akko... but how did such a significant artifact end up in the hands of an apprentice of magic?
Sounds quite a significant artifact, Akko... but it bears the question of how it came to be wielded by an inexperienced magician?
Your description certainly paints a lot of promise, Akko. If I were interested to view one of her performances, how shall I do so?

That does in fact sound impressive and graceful, Akko. I would be interested in watching one of her shows, but I presume you're more familiar with the process of securing a reservation for her shows than I am.
Oh, Burgh? I'm not entirely sure either, Galatea, but I do know that he focuses mainly on bug-themed art. No surprise that he's a bug-type specialist too.
Well... I'm not too sure what kind of art Burgh specialized in, but I heard he specialized in bug-themed artwork. He's so enamored with bug-types that his Pokémon team is composed entirely of them.
People think that saying certain phrases in your presence will yield some kind of reward, Galatea? That's quite an odd setup...
Why exactly would people harbor that misconception, Galatea? How is talking to you supposed to be rewarded?
Those animates you mentioned sound like they originated from different cultures, Galatea. If I can get the creation story from each animate's culture of origin, that would be valuable data.

Valuable data for my research are those that originated from distinct and mutually-exclusive cultures, and the names you mentioned certainly suggest so. It already promises to be a fruitful visit, Galatea.
Taoist? Is that a dominant religion where you're from, Miko? I don't recall any religions with that name, but regions sometimes have different names for the same religion.
I'm afraid I haven't heard of "Taoism" before, Miko, but I wouldn't rule out the possibility that I've known it under a different name. That sometimes happens with multicultural religions.
... Right... You wouldn't happen to be drinking pure alcohol, are you? I'm still interested in knowing the type of alcohol in Gensokyo, Miko.
... Yes, I bet alcohol is a famous type of alcohol in Gensokyo... Anyhow, what kind of alcohol do you consume, Miko, because I doubt you drink pure alcohol.
You administer peace with diplomacy instead of violence, Miko... Besides, I've known a group that followed that line of reasoning, and they were only doing it to benefit themselves.
Peace administered through violence isn't peace at all, Miko. Also, I've already had a run-in with a group that had the same rhetoric, and peace certainly wasn't their true goal.
That's an interesting statement about resurrection, Miko. However, what did you mean that yours was a miracle? Was it a miracle because it succeeded, or because it rarely happens?
I wasn't even aware that type of resurrection was possible, Miko. I'm just confused which part of your resurrection was a miracle: the success, or the act itself?
That seems a likely story, Sayaka. But there's one hole in it: If a magical girl wished for this world's creation, then where did that girl come from?
Very intriguing story, Sayaka. However, it begs the question of where that particular magical girl could have originated from if she preceded this world...
I trust that you know the proper gear for exploring caves and old ruins, Sayaka. Having the proper attire is important in keeping yourself comfortable.
Dress well, and dress properly, Sayaka. Exploring any old crevice is always much more enjoyable when you're well-prepared.
... I suppose being pretty... and settling down would be a... good life, Sayaka. Everyone should live happily ever after...
... Yes... who wouldn't want to meet the man of their life... and be loved for your whole... life, Sayaka...?
History might be full of terrible stories, but that's precisely the reason we should study it, Sayaka. If we don't, then we are doomed to repeat it.
If we don't learn about the atrocities of our past, Sayaka, then we wouldn't have the wisdom to avoid performing the same mistakes in the future. It would be an unending cycle of atrocities.
I don't think I can feel comfortable under the thought that a single being can completely remake history at a whim. Not even any of the primordial deities had that much power at their disposal.
A god-like entity that can rewrite the very course of history to fulfill the whim of a girl. What a comforting thought.
... Alright... I think I'll take your word about this... male friend of yours, Sayaka... and leave you to your thoughts...
I can't speak for that book of naked illustrations that you mentioned, Sayaka, but those type of books were quite common centuries ago... For scientific purposes, of course.
I'm not exactly surprised that a book of naked illustrations exists, Sayaka. As a matter of fact, I'd say that there could be dozens of them, crafted for anatomical study purposes.
And what precisely would you want from me in the event you win, Kazuma? Free history lessons? Any period of history you might be interested in, I can help you study them.

I wonder what kind of activities you'd want to do with me if you win, Kazuma... Perhaps getting to pet my Pokémon? Many people are eager to see my Pokémon, and my Pokémon are happy with the attention.
Well, you can clearly see that I have a thing for black outfits, Rin. This outfit is somewhat iconic too, since I always wear this to battles.
There is a Pokémon evolution line whose members are named Kling, Klang, and Klingklang. Whoever named those 3 Pokémon must have been feeling lazy that day.
It would have to be "Conkeldurr", Rin. It's sounds very awkward, regardless of how you try to approach its pronunciation.
I'm not really sure if I'm up to par for a foot race, Emi. I'm more experienced in biking rather than running.
It goes without saying that bugs are just Burgh's thing... Artworks - Bugs... Pokémon - Bugs... I don't think he's ever battled using a non-bug-type...
Well... you've been giving interesting replies to my questions... so I suppose the key was giving you interesting questions to answer, Galatea...
I've found your answers to my inquiries to be quite informative, Galatea... If this was that type of game, then I must have won by now...
I see... Well, there must be quite a handful of animates on that gallery, and at least one of them must have been programmed to talk about culture... It's worth the gamble, Galatea.
That's quite the impediment to my plans, Galatea... I suppose there's no other way of finding out aside from visiting that gallery... I'll just have to play the odds...
Oh, it must be very nice having a wife you can hug all the time, Jura... Not that I would know how having a wife would feel...
I suppose when you're in space, having a wife at close quarters is good for psychological health... Although, I wouldn't know how it would be like to have a wife.
... I don't think that's quite it, Jura... It's more of a... case of me being too busy at work to... meet up with men... I suppose that makes sense...
... I have a more... probable explanation, Jura... I've just been... swallowed up by my work... is all...

Oh, is it common for Mejarians to play strip poker during birthdays, Jura? Anyway, you're quite youthful for someone in their mid-20s. I can't remember the last time I had that much bounce in my steps.

I can't say that attending strip poker games as a way of celebrating birthdays has caught on in this planet yet, Jura... Besides, age is just a number. And you definitely act quite young for someone quickly approaching their 30s.
You don't seem particularly thrilled about your birthday, Meia. I'll chalk it up to a cultural thing.
Is it common for Mejarians to dismiss birthdays as "just another day"? That's the impression I got from you, Meia.
You're only 20? I guess I'm just bad at guessing ages. I once mistook a 10 year old boy to be 18...
... I was never good at estimating ages... I keep mistaking 10 and 11 year old trainers as 18 year olds...

Everybody I know requires some form of sleep, Galatea. I do wish sleep wasn't a necessity, and I could use that time more productively. You must accomplish a lot, with all the time you don't spend sleeping.
Despite everybody having a different sleep pattern, I don't believe anybody can survive without sleeping, Galatea. It must be great not having to sleep and being productive with the extra time.
"Greek" Pantheon? I don't believe I've heard of that before, nor the names you just mentioned, Galatea. Would you happen to know details about that religion?
Those names... They're unfamiliar to me, Galatea. Dead religions are always a classic topic in archaeology, so I would appreciate any details you can remember.
I do love a good ice cream cone, Maki. As for my favorite flavor... hmm... Is it Chocolate... Mint, or Snozberries...?
You can never go wrong with a well-made ice cream cone, Maki, especially when the flavor is... what flavor is best for a cone again?
If it's Sinnohlian cuisine that you're curious about, I would suggest trying out the rice balls, ~supernova~. Some people might call them "jelly donut", but I assure you they're made of rice.

There's a lot of Sinnohlian cuisine that you need to try out, ~supernova~, but I would suggest trying out something small first. You should try out the local rice balls, which are made of rice and not jelly donuts like some people believe.
This place seems to be more primitive than back home, ~supernova~. I couldn't find a Pokéball or a Global Trading Center in here. I don't think the people running this place have even heard of those.
This place isn't quite as advanced as Sinnoh, ~supernova~. It seems that Pokéballs, Time Capsules, and Global Terminals have not hit it big in this place yet, as I couldn't find any of them.

I don't know about this place, but back home in Sinnoh and in Unova, there are psychic-type Pokémon which can be interpreted as magic. Some people also have psychic powers, but their powers are a bit more limited.

I'm not quite familiar with this place myself, but back in Sinnoh... Well, it's not quite magic, but psychic-types are probably close to what you're thinking of. Some people also happen to have psychic powers as well.
I happen to be visiting a nearby museum, and I heard that this game has a rather high-stakes version of poker. I do love high-stakes games like this, Neptune.
Well, I had a long day visiting the local museum, and I figured this would be a good way to cool off. The grapevine had... interesting stories about this place, so I came to take a look.
I have no idea either, ~supernova~. It must be a cultural thing from Unova, considering they're the only ones mixing up the two.
The answer to that question also eludes me, ~supernova~. It's almost exclusively Unovans making that mistake, but I've been to Unova, and I don't think I saw a jelly donut resembling a rice ball.

Yes, I was indeed referring to psychic-types seen in Pokémon battles, ~supernova~. There are some people who believes that psychic-type moves have a logical explanation, but we simply aren't advanced enough to understand it.

I do agree that psychic-types look magical in Pokémon battles, ~supernova~, but only because we don't yet understand the mechanics of psychic powers. Their mystique might be lessened once science discover how they work.

It's more of a case of the Pokémon games being based on real-life Pokémon leagues, ~supernova~ .There are some... inaccuracies... in the story, but most of the events in the games happened in real life.

Of course they're real, ~supernova~, otherwise how would I be standing here in front of you? I wouldn't say the games are a perfect representation of history, but that's to be expected for any popular media.
As a matter of fact, that quote has been proven many times throughout history, ~supernova~. Many things that have been deemed mystical have now been explained by science.
That quote has been proven correct time and time again throughout history, and it's safe to assume that it will continue to do so in the future.

... If by that, you meant sports having their video game adaptions, then Pokémon isn't any different, ~supernova~. By what did you mean by... are you saying that the Pokémon games... made it to your world? That can't possibly be.
... Yes, Pokémon had a video game adaptation the same way other sports did... but are you saying that the video games reached your world? I'm guessing you're just thinking of something else.
Gods who lived among the people... How intriguing... Do you happen to remember if your artist had told you about the creation story of this pantheon, Galatea?
These gods, they were physically present in the mortal world, among humans... Of all the stories your artist told you, did he happen to tell you how this world came to be, Galatea?

That's actually a blessing in disguise if you think about it, Galatea. You can help me study this "Greek" Pantheon you speak of. With all your knowledge and experience, you'll be a very valuable source for me.

If you genuinely have nothing else to do, you should help me research your "Greek" Pantheon, Galatea. Having a living witness to a now-extinct culture... Why, that's quite the jackpot for a historian!

This outfit I'm wearing today is quite iconic, if I say so myself, Marinette. It's the personal look I've had for years now. It's perfect for the cold weather, and I don't really mind the hot weather that much.
This is the outfit I've had for quite a while now, Marinette. Most of my outfits are exactly like this set, although I do have some pairs for hotter weather.
I would suggest playing some piano music, Futaba. Preferably, one that gives the sense of an upcoming battle, just to get everyone into a competitive mood.
I do think this place could use a little bit of piano music. Nothing too fancy, just any intense piano piece which instills the fighting spirit to everyone in this game.
I'm going to take a gamble, and say that you weren't a Pokémon trainer in the past, Florence. As for what your job was... a waitress, perhaps.
You don't look like you have what it takes to be a Pokémon trainer, no offense, so I'm guessing you used to be a waitress, Florence.
That's fascinating! What practical applications do ribbon-like arms have, Ribbon Girl?
I don't believe I've ever seen anything quite like that before, Ribbon Girl! I do wonder if the ability to turn your arms into ribbons has any uses...
I would say that time Team Galactic destroyed the Celestic Ruins with bombs, Saki. So much history, gone just like that...
As far as bad luck goes, the destruction of the Celestic Ruins at the hands of Team Galactic has to rank highly, Saki. We didn't even get to study the ruins in full, and now we will never be able to.
Are there any physical limitations as to what you can transform into, Shantae? Can you transform to an inanimate object?
Can you transform to anything you want, Shantae, or are there some things you can't transform into? What about inanimate objects, can you transform into those?
I came here because I've never played strip poker before, Pyrrha. Taking on new challenges is a very refreshing experience, regardless of the outcome.

Well, I've heard about this place through the grapevine, and I figured I'd check it out and play a game, Pyrrha. After all, strip poker isn't a game I've played before, and we should always strive to have new experiences.

I don't mean to be prideful, but I'm already famous in the Sinnoh region due to my status as the League Champion, and possibly in other regions as well, Pyrrha. I do wish to become a famous archaeologist as well, like my grandma did.
I'm already famous in the Pokémon Leagues as the Sinnoh League Champion, Pyrrha. Although, I also aspire to become famous as an archaeologist, following the footsteps of my grandma.
Are you a vegan, Twilight? Just so you know, some kinds of meat are actually artificial meat made for a vegetarian diet. I'm not sure if the hamburger you ate was real or artificial meat, though.
Going on a meatless diet, Twilight? Well, I can't claim to know if the hamburger you ate was real meat, but it could easily have been artificial meat, perfect for vegans like you.

That business with the portal to the Distortion World appears to have cleared up, and I haven't heard a peep from Team Galactic since then, so I suppose that's all magical emergencies in Sinnoh accounted for, Twilight.
Unless Team Galactic kicks off a plot to open up another portal to the Distortion World, I doubt there's any more magical emergencies to be had in Sinnoh, Twilight.
I normally wear this many layers because it is very cold all year round in Sinnoh, Twilight. Although in the context of this game, I maximized my layer count for a strategic advantage.

Wearing as many layers as I'm allowed in this game makes it easier for me to win, Twilight. To be fair, these are also the clothes I wear everyday. The weather in Sinnoh is very frigid for most of the year.
I would highly recommend trying the Salmon Hot Pot, Erufuda. It has salmon meat, vegetables, mushroom, and tofu tossed into a pot of salmon stock. It's a must try for any tourist in Sinnoh!
I can see why they would say that, Erufuda. The amount of greasy fried foods I came across in Unova was simply outstanding! It's like they only know how to deep fry ingredients in there.
It seems you can't walk two blocks in Unova without coming across some deep fried foods, Erufuda. If you have no self-control, it's so easy to gain a couple of kilos within a week.
That's such an incredible and rather unorthodox use of those powers, Ribbon Girl. Is there a drawback with the powers though? It all seems too good to be true?
What a creative way of using those powers... Is there any negative aspects to those powers, Ribbon Girl? It seems like a great blessing otherwise.
If you live close to this place, then I could give you a lift, Yusuke. It's not like I'm in a particular hurry to get home after this game.
I suppose giving you a ride home after this game wouldn't cause me to run afoul of my schedule, provided that you live relatively nearby, Yusuke.
As much as I would love having an army of Garchomps, it's simply not practical, Myriam. Not to mention the vulnerability to fairy and ice types. That's why I prefer a well-balanced team.
Why create a highly-specialized team with a particular weakness to ice-types, when you can go with a well-balanced team with no weaknesses? I say my idea is the correct one, Myriam.
The reason you can't just trot in a team of six Arceuses is because there is only one Arceus, Myriam. Not the mention that it probably wouldn't be easy to capture in the first place.
Well, for starters, there is only one Arceus in the entire world. Secondly, attempting to capture a god probably wouldn't end well. So, no, I don't think anyone can do that, Myriam.
My grandma had this big book of creation stories, appropriately called "The Big Book of Creation Stories". It's what aroused my curiosity about creation myths of different cultures.

There was "The Big Book of Creation Stories", which is exactly what it says in the title. I learned a lot from that book when I was a child, and it spurred me to learn about creation stories around the world.
Hmm? A psychic projection...? And you have quite the control over it from the sound of things. Perhaps your powers are more powerful than I thought... (I need to keep a closer eye on her!)
You must be quite powerful to be able to have that much control over a psychic projection, Perona. (This could mean trouble...)
Oh, are you checking your work schedule on your tablet, Meia? You don't happen to have any appointments after this game, do you?
A laser ring... I remember an artifact we found: a ring with a tiny knife hidden inside. Not particularly useful for actual use, but it's interesting that such a device was created.

That wouldn't be the first time I've seen a weapon disguised as a ring. We once received a gun fashioned into a ring, as a donated artifact, and it had allegedly blown off the user's fingers when used.
Some countries still have kings and queens, while others have abolished the monarchy. Does Sinnoh have a monarchy? Who knows? I certainly don't.
You mentioned something about your friend investigating a "Void Century", Nami. Can you elaborate on that?
Lucario is one of my Pokémon, Nami. I've had him since I was a teenager. This is the longest I've been separated from him, and it's making me worry.
You mentioned many different types of ruins dotting your homeland, Dust. Do you have any knowledge about the history behind them?
I'm afraid I have never heard of the Moonblood legend you are referring to, Dust. What does the legend say, and how does it connect to you?
Considering how exciting it is for me to learn about the more discreet side of history, I can't imagine how big of a revelation it must be for you, Meia.
Oh, there's definitely a lot of lewd artifacts on this planet, Meia. You can't excavate at an archaeological site without digging up one. Of course, we can't display them.
Meia, that colonization story of yours sounds like a modern version of a creation story. I'd be grateful if you can indulge some details of that story.
That's an intriguing offer, Meia. I was planning on returning to the Sinjoh Ruins, to study the Mystri Stage. It's said that the world will be reborn there.
Is that true, Meia? Is your version of history really that horribly altered? That's the ultimate nightmare for someone who studies history.
Does your planet's version of Earth history really omit men, Meia? How did they accomplish that? Regrettably, Earth's history is centered around male figures.
Hold on, Meia. Did you say that Earth has achieved galactic colonization? It seems that I was so focused on studying the past that I didn't notice the future arriving.
Sounds like that would be an interesting period of your planet's history to study, Meia. It's not at all different from studying Earth's history through archaeology.
Your statement makes me wonder how many manuscripts and engravings I've read in the past also alter history like your planet did, Meia. Very intriguing.
Ah, yes, those types of rule have existed all throughout history, and there are some that still exists today. It says a lot about human nature, doesn't it, Meia?
I suppose that's a sensible move, Meia. I remember a similar situation in the past where communities on separate islands are connected solely by trading ships.
The manuscript was probably allegorical in nature, Meia. There was that one instance where a young trainer produced an egg with the help of an Arceus. Perhaps that's what reborn means.
Oh, that's a very interesting and well-written prophecy, Dust. From the sound of it, you were destined for greatness. Have you fulfilled the prophecy yet?
"Wars of Unification". So many great empires have risen and fallen through warfare. Sinnoh is fortunate to have been relatively peaceful in its history.
I somehow doubt we're fictional, Mary, because how can you explain our presence here? Besides, a competent writer would have made me easier to beat.
There are many archaeologists like you, Mary. I do think that part of the appeal of archaeology is being able to travel the world as part of the studies.
History isn't always clean and pretty, and there are many details that people would rather not know. I'm interested in hearing more from you, Mary.
History is filled with examples of leaders choosing honor before reason, leading to unnecessary bloodshed. I'm happy it didn't go that way, Mary.
All of those things you listed are horrible, Mary. I do hope things have changed for the better.
That's great news, Jessie! I always say that explorations are more interesting with a traveling companion. What time are you available, and do you have a particular cave in mind?
That's good to hear, Jessie! I don't know about cabbage fields, but there's a couple of caves that I'm think of exploring. What date can you go?
Oh, you live near a cave system, Jessie? That just sounds perfect! I suppose I can spare some time later tonight and do some preliminary surveys.
You mentioned that your house is a short distance away from a cave system, Jessie? That's an opportunity. I can do some analysis on the cave entrance this evening.
That creation story you've mentioned might not be as far-fetched as you think, Jessie. I do remember reading a similar myth once. Want to hear it?
Your friend might be onto something there, Jessie. I do recall reading an ancient creation myth similar to that. I can tell the story if you're interested.

I must warn you that this a rather lengthy but gripping story, Jessie, but you can tell me to stop any time if you want. To preface, this came from an ancient manuscript that preceded all of the current political entities. Anyway, here's the story: Stewie already has a time machine built in which he uses to go back in time to get back and embarrass Brian. When Brian finds out, they fight in the time machine, pressing random buttons and switches which makes the machine glitch. It transports them outside of the space-time continuum; non-existence; no past, present, or future; no universe; a blank canvas. Stewie has his return pad that will bring them back to wherever they want to go by locking on to their coordinates. However, it operates on the laws of physics and since they are outside the space-time continuum, there are no laws of physics; they can create their own physics. The only way to get back home is taking a risk that could result in their deaths: overloading the return pad’s reactor to release enough energy to blow them back into the universe. The explosion is successful in propelling them back into reality. A few days later, Stewie brings Brian a diagram of the Big Bang Theory’s cosmic background radiation compared to the energy spectrum of the return pad and they match exactly. This means that the return pad’s explosion was the Big Bang. Stewie explains that time and space didn't exist before their explosion as they were outside the space-continuum. This is due to a temporal causality loop where the universe created Stewie so he could create the universe, so it could create him and on and on. We are then introduced to a character, Bertram, who finds out about Stewie's time machine and uses it to go back in time to kill Leonardo Da Vinci, Stewie's ancestor, essentially killing Stewie and erasing him from history. This creates ripples in time in the present that originated from the past. Although this wouldn't happen with an ordinary person ceasing to exist, Stewie was the one who created the universe. By erasing him from history, he wouldn't be there to create the universe, meaning it never existed. To stop this, Stewie and Brian travel back to before Bertram killed his ancestor. Stewie and Bertram's history goes far back, as they are both children of Peter. Therefore, Bertram couldn't just kill Peter or a recent ancestor on Peter's side as he too would cease to exist, so he had to go back enough generations to snuff Stewie's genus without snuffing out his own. Bertram finally arrives and him and Stewie begin to battle each other for Da Vinci's life. Bertram succeeds in killing Da Vinci where after Stewie also kills Bertram. However, Stewie and Brian are still alive, meaning there is still a chance of him being born. He must have done or will do something to save the universe. He figures since Da Vinci's DNA is inside of him, he himself can pass it on, taking Da Vinci's place. This is a large chance but the only way to find out is to send Brian back to the present. When Brian arrives, everything is still intact, meaning Stewie succeeded. Brian receives a letter from The Vatican that was left by “Da Vinci” 500 years ago. It reads that Stewie placed himself into a cryogenic stasis device and is buried in the basement of their home. Brian goes to dig him up and sure enough Stewie is there.
I agree that the Internet is very useful, Jessie. I can publish my findings on the internet, and read the studies of other archaeologists from around the world.
The Internet has been helpful in lightening my schedule, Jessie. I can now conduct meetings online instead of having to show up in person in another region.
Jessie, you mentioned a president that got impeached due to inappropriate sexual conduct. There has to be more to that story. That seems like a harsh sentence.
Jessie, you said that you portrayed a Cleopatra figure in a film. Can you elaborate about her story? I'm particularly interested in female historical figures.
Jessie, you mentioned a figure named Cleopatra. Details about female figures tend be particularly hazy, so I would be grateful if you can tell her story.
Hold on, Jessie. Was that a pornographic film you were talking about? That's not a reliable source at all!
Were you describing a pornographic film, Jessie?! I thought you would be talking about a documentary!
Jessie... I don't really think a 20 year old device would count as an artifact. Besides, that's not the type of information I needed to hear.
Comparing sexual trends between cultures could be interesting... Wait a minute, were you talking about one of your pornographic films, Jessie?
I suppose studying the historical shift... Hey, I remembered something. That movie you were describing, Jessie. Does it happen to be a porn film?
No thanks, Jessie. I would rather hear from more reliable sources.
A porn film isn't going to help my studies of history, Jessie.
Excuse me, Mary, but you described me using a word that I wasn't familiar with. "Milf"? Can you just explain to me what that means, if you please?
Twink is a term for boys, right? Are you saying that a genocide occurred because a boy who happened to be the friend of the leader got murdered, Mary?
I find that kind of hard to believe, Mary. Surely, I would be a more popular character if I was easier to beat. It's not like this game uses much skill at all.
History is filled with both heroes and monsters, Mary. It's just how history repeats itself. I must say though, "Angel of Death" is indeed a fearsome moniker.
