I wouldn't be surprised at all if that's the case, Meia. History is written by the victors after all. Even today, this practice still exists.
Past and present, revisionism has always existed, Meia, and I expect it will continue to the future. This is why studying history is so important.
If the past is any indication, then I would say that is indeed human nature, Meia. You either learn to live together, or one of you gets wiped out.
That's just a regular pattern I've seen in history, Meia. The cycle only pauses when everyone learn to coexist, or if one gets assimilated by the other.
Speaking of self-sacrifice, Meia, it has been part of the tradition of many ancient cultures. It was believed that human sacrifices will bring good fortune for the survivors.
Self-sacrifice for the sake of the survivors has been a tradition all throughout history. It's remarkable that the practice apparently hasn't died out yet.
Ribbon Girl, you mentioned something about visiting a temple grounds. Can you elaborate on that temple ground for me? I want to know everything you can tell me.
Ribbon Girl, is this Spring Man that you mentioned a real person or just a fictional character? What are his qualities that you look up to?
A secret subfaction, huh? The ideas of a secret organization is always frightening, since you can't keep track of their actions since... well, they're secret.
Are you saying that your mask was a recent invention, Ribbon Girl? How exactly do people with your powers function before their invention?
I think it goes without saying that it's more of an obsession than love by that point, Mary. Anyhow, it's not something that's unheard of in history.
...Mom, I'd like to... friend? Was that correct, Mary? People have said that I get along well with young trainers, so you might be correct on that regard.
Stopping a genocide... I don't think many people can claim to have accomplished that, Dust. If you don't mind me asking, why were the Moonbloods being hunted down?
So you have a shady subfaction, and another faction that's potentially shady and potentially non-existent. Those thoughts must be keeping you on your toes, Ribbon Girl.
It's always a good idea to look up to a role model when you're striving to be a competitor, Ribbon Girl. I know that many young trainers idolize me.
Not having the ability to control your powers seems more like a curse, Ribbon Girl. I know someone who can't control her psychic powers, and she has to sleep most of the time as a result.
An antique floor mosaic? That's a very valuable thing to see for a historian like me. I'm very interested in visiting this Misangan Temple Grounds, Ribbon Girl.
Meia, is it true that Jura is part of the same space traveling crew as you? I wouldn't have known if someone hadn't told me.
Jura can't really be your crewmate, can she, Meia? It doesn't look like you're part of the same job sector at all.
That does explain everything. I was just utterly baffled that Jura was supposed to work anywhere remotely close to a ship cockpit while wearing a dress like that.
Thanks for that explanation, Meia. Everything makes sense now, aside from the fact that Jura would wear that dress while piloting a ship, but who am I to judge foreign fashion sense?
Ah yes, that pyramid theory, among other ridiculous "theories" about ancient construction. Why is it so difficult to believe that ancient humans are capable of such feats, Jolyne?
That pyramid "theory"... It is only believable if you operate under the belief that ancient humans were borderline brain-dead. Don't you agree, Jolyne?
It is highly unlikely that aliens will travel across galaxies just to help humans build stone megastructures and I couldn't make any sense of it, but where more informed than them, Jolyne.
You were asking me what type of ruins I was curious about, Jolyne? I was talking of old structures that have been damaged beyond repair, and is now a reminder of past architecture.
Any old building that are still standing can be considered a ruin, Jolyne, but I'm particularly interested in those that are culturally or historically significant.
Jolyne, you mentioned a queen who died after having sex with a "horse"... What exactly is a "horse"? I haven't heard of that term before.
Jolyne, you talked about a queen and a "horse" earlier... Can you elaborate on what a "horse" is? It might make the context clearer for me.
Jolyne, you were telling me a fascinating story earlier, but you mentioned a "horse". I would appreciate it if you explain to me what it is.
Lucario shouldn't take too long in Smash, but I'm curious that you had a similar story, Jolyne. Would you mind telling it?
I just hope Lucario is doing well in Smash, but on that note, you mentioned something about this happening before, Jolyne. That would be an interesting story to listen to, if you please.
Do you really do all of that by yourself, Shantae? I never knew you had that type of fighting spirit in you.
If what you're saying is true, then I have severely misinterpreted your personality, Shantae. I didn't take you for someone who can act as a one-woman army.
Well, I suppose that is a rather comforting thought. Still, you must keep alert in any case. Some rumors turn out to be true, Ribbon Girl.
There's no reason to be wary of an unconfirmed rumor, I suppose. Either way, it's till better to keep alert at all times, Ribbon Girl.
That would be great, Ribbon Girl. Even though my schedule is quite busy, I can spare some time for this, especially since I could potentially get valuable information from this trip..
Since this could of potential relevance to my current research, I would be glad to spare some time for a trip to that temple, Ribbon Girl.
What a strange phenomenon! How did the world lose a century's worth of history, Nami? Perhaps we can look at my historical records to bridge the gap then...
I've heard of regions losing their historical records, but for an entire world to do so? That is almost inconceivable, Nami! Perhaps some of my researches can fill in the missing details...

I know the prehistory is, well, before recorded history and is forever lost, but for a portion of recorded history to be lost like that... I need to check my records. Perhaps the answer lies within them, Nami...
Shantae, you mentioned that it is part of your duty to raid caves all by yourself. I am struggling to figure why that would be, so I would appreciate it if you could explain it to me.
You mentioned that you raid caves "when duty calls", Shantae. Is that what you do for a living, Shantae? Forgive me for all this questions, but I'm just very curious about that part of your life.

I couldn't help but notice those writing you showed us, Komi. I recognize it as the native writing back in Sinnoh, and the surrounding regions. I never expected to meet another native speaker this far away.
I never expected to see that writing system being used here of all places, Komi. The only other places I've seen it are back home, which is far, far away from here. Great penmanship too, I must say.
To answer you earlier question about guns, Tomoko, I have my Garchomp with me, and she's powerful enough to protect all of us from an attacker.
About your earlier question, Tomoko, my Garchomp can handle a shooting attack should one happen in here. I'd even dare say that having her is a bit of an overkill for that situation.
You mentioned a folklore story, Komi... Can you elaborate on it? It could be an interesting glimpse at your hometown's culture.
It might not be what I had asked for, but I'm interested in hearing about that folklore story you mentioned, Komi.
Komi, you mentioned a Perry Expedition that altered your local culture. Was it a cultural expedition, or did the expedition have other goals in mind?
I've never heard of this Perry Expedition, Komi. Do you any details regarding that expedition? Was it their goal to spread culture into your lands?
Arash, you were chanting something in another language earlier. What was it, a prayer of some sort?
Was that an incantation you were reciting earlier in another language, Arash? Or is it some sort of a prayer?
How did your imagined creation story lead to a revenge fantasy, Tomoko? I can't quite make the connection.
You mentioned earlier that you had an imagined creation story that also doubled as a revenge fantasy, Tomoko. I'm not exactly sure how you connected those two things.
I was talking about historical ruins, Tomoko, but I wouldn't discount the possibility of the existence of such a ruin. History can imitate art sometimes.
I had historical ruins in mind, but I wouldn't be surprised if there exists a ruin that does indeed contain skeletons and treasures within.
I haven't heard of a "Pablo Escobar" before, Tomoko. Can you elaborate on his accomplishments?
You mentioned a historical figure named "Pablo Escobar" earlier, Tomoko. I'm unfamiliar with him, and would appreciate it if you can give a summary of his legacy.
I wasn't asking for personal historical stories indeed, but I'm still interested in what happened next in your story, Tomoko.
I didn't expect to hear personal stories, but since you've already begun your story, might as well finish it. What happened next, Tomoko?
I wouldn't say that hobbies would be that rudimentary without the internet, Tomoko. Leisurely games stretch far back in history, Tomoko. I can give you a rundown if you're interested.

Even though it is true that internet greatly accelerated the development of leisurely games, they had already progressed past tin cans and jumping games way before that. I can tell you the whole story if you want, Tomoko.
My, this is quite a long story indeed, Komi. I'll make sure to read it in the future. I do hope it doesn't get mixed up with my research papers. I'll never be able to recover it in that case.
You weren't exaggerating, Komi. This story really is long. I'll have to remember to read it in the future. Hopefully, I don't lose it before then.
About that historical story you mentioned earlier, Komi, what kind of far-reaching consequences were you alluding to?
Going back to the story you were telling earlier, Komi... I would assume that the expedition greatly influenced the local culture... or were you describing a different type of consequence?
Do you happen to have a form of communication with this Reimu, Miko? She might have met my Lucario if she attended.
Can I request something from you, Miko? I would be happy if your can ask your Reimu if she has met my Lucario in the tournament.
Is Kokoro your daughter, Miko? The rebellious phase can be especially rough for girls.
The Kokoro you mentioned is your daughter, Miko? Girls can be very difficult to handle when they enter they're rebellious phase.
You mentioned a creation story about Gensokyo, Miko? Would you be so nice to provide more details on that? I haven't heard any creation stories that are quite like it.
I'm interested in the creation story you mentioned earlier, Miko? Can you remember any more details? It's quite unique compared to the other creation stories I know of.
All empires come and go, Miko, no matter how mighty and powerful. Besides, the cultural impact of long-gone empires last much, much longer than their physical ruins.
Every empire ends, regardless of power and status, Miko. It's more of a question of when and how. The cultural influence of such an empire continues even if said empire has long been forgotten.
You mentioned a couple of historical figures from Gensokyo, Miko. May I ask what about their legacy make them impressive in your opinion?
Were those historical figures you mentioned in Gensokyo a prominent presence in Gensokyo's history? I'll be interested in hearing about their legacy, Miko.
I've been meaning to ask, Miko... If you're the crown prince, does that mean that you became king?
I see now why you have "Crown Prince" as your title... But did you ever ascend to the throne, Miko?
Gossips about a certain historical figure being a woman has been a commonly used method of slander throughout history, Miko. I wouldn't just believe any gossip like that.
If the gossips are to be believed, half of historical figures are secretly female. It's difficult to believe that types of gossip when they are so rampantly used, Miko.
That was an interesting story, Miko. It's interesting that a centralized government was such a massive game-changer back then, when it is commonplace today.
It's interesting that a centralized government used to be a radical idea, when most people don't even take note of it nowadays. Don't you find that interesting too, Miko?
What would you say was the biggest difference between your "playthings" and modern toys, Miko?
Are those "playthings" really that archaic when compared to modern one, Miko? That's interesting to note.
It wasn't like that, Saki... Lucario can handle himself under most situations. I'm just worried that I haven't heard anything about him.
No, Saki! Don't just believe anything you hear about me! We shouldn't be encouraging anyone who would make up a lie like that!
There's absolutely no truth about those stories, Saki! You shouldn't believe anything out of it.
You don't know any creation story at all, Saki? Not even when your parents were telling you a bedtime story?
Surely, you must have heard at least one creation story, Saki. Anything... even from children's books.
I wasn't talking about urban exploration, Saki. I was thinking more in the lines of old caves, and long-abandoned temples.
I'm not really sure what value I would get from exploring abandoned warehouses, Saki. Exploration of ancient ruins would yield much more useful data for me.

Saki, by "biker gang", did you mean those group of riders with their smoke-guzzling motorcycles that keeps clogging up the major streets? I would have hardly rated them, but what makes them great to you?
Did you play arcade during your youth, or did you just read about them, Saki? Either way, it's not often I come across an arcade enthusiast.
Ooh, arcades... I haven't seen an arcade machine in years. Did you grow up playing them, Saki?
Meiji Era? That's such a long time ago, Saki! Your sister must also be a historian like myself. That era isn't exactly common knowledge among people nowadays.
The only people I know of with that much knowledge of the Meiji Era are historians, Saki. Your sister is a historian, isn't she?
As much as I love Yakitori, I would hardly consider it as a turning point in history, Saki.
You know someone who's a high-class prostitute, Saki...? This might have been too much information for me...
Your... deputy... is also playing here, Meia? This doesn't happen to be the Mejarian equivalent of a workplace bonding activity, is it?
You brought your second-in-command... to a strip poker event, Meia? That's quite an unusual way of befriending your superiors. Is this a Mejarian thing?
You got separated from your squad leader, and in the process of looking for her... you joined a strip poker game? That plan doesn't quite make sense, Jura.
If your goal was to reunite with your squad leader, I don't think participating in a strip poker game would be the best way of accomplishing it, Jura.
If I was separated from my squad leader, and I have to come looking for her, I wouldn't consider a strip poker game to be the best place to look, Jura.
Regarding your earlier request, Jura, I'm afraid I can't do that. I only have my Pokémon attack people when it's absolutely necessary, and this isn't one of them.
I know you're still angry about earlier, Jura, but I can't just have my Pokémon attack her - Pokémon are more than just living weapons. Besides, she did return you to normal, didn't she?
Violence isn't the answer, Jura, especially when it would involve a Pokémon. Anyhow, what she did was pretty harmless, and the last thing we need is to reignite this quarrel.
(If she does lash out again, then I suppose Spiritomb should be able to handle her. Until then, I would suggest against agitating her, Jura.)
(Don't worry, Jura. I have Spiritomb ready in my hands if she pulls that trick again. Anyway, I would suggest avoiding... whatever you did to anger her in the first place.)

(I'm keeping a close eye on her, Jura, and I've decided sending out Spiritomb would be the best corrective action should she go berserk again. Just don't provoke her until then, and everything would be fine.)
Haru, you mentioned the luck gods earlier. Can you tell me more about them? Quite a few pantheons worshiped a god of luck, and I want to check any similarities between your pantheons.
You have a Luck Deity in your pantheon, Haru? Would you mind telling me more, because I want to cross-examine your deity with the luck deities of other pantheons.
Ah, I see you're someone who values the undisputed truth over baseless rumors, ~lucina~. I can understand that viewpoint.
As fun as trading gossips can be, the truth must always take top priority of our attention.
I can relate to that, ~lucina~. There's been so many history-altering events that simply choosing one would undeservedly downplay the effects of other significant events.

True, choosing the most impactful event in history would be like choosing among different candies from a jar, when you want all of them equally. I can understand why you couldn't take a pick, ~lucina~.

Wait, how do we know that the Lucario you've met is my Lucario, ~lucina~?... Hold on, if there's was only one Lucario in Smash, then it must be him! It's wonderful that he's having a great time in Smash!

I'm always willing to take on new challenges and adventures. I figured a strip poker game would do just that.
It's nice to engage in new experiences from time to time. On that note, I'm afraid I'm not too experienced at this game.
As much as I enjoy training my Pokémon and studying mythology, I felt I needed a bit of a break and try something new.
I think I'm getting the hang of this game now. Don't expect me to go down as easily this time.
My inexperience at this game is becoming apparent, but I think I've figured out the proper strategies.
Not exactly a good showing from me so far, but I think I've identified the flaws in my decision process.
The best thing to do about mistakes is learn from them, and that's exactly what I've done. Expect a tougher challenge from now on.
Everyone experiences failure, even trainers of my level. What separates great trainers from the others is the ability to learn from them.
This is it: my last stand. Don't expect me to give up my chances at winning.
I may be on my final battle, but I'm not giving up!
A tough challenge! This is exactly why I agreed to play this game in the first place.
This is The Inventory, right? What's with the curtains? Is this placed closed?
I find it odd that The inventory is closed at this hours. Isn't late evening the peak hours for a bar like this?
I'm surprised that they let us play in The Inventory while it's closed... That why they put the curtains up, right?
I didn't know The Inventory would put up curtains during strip poker games. I had heard that it was played in full view of the other patrons.
I must say, it's been a long time since I've seen a curtain that large.
Have you considered using that curtain to clean yourself, ~male~?
Do you think the staff would mind if you use that curtain to wipe yourself, ~male~?
Is this where ghost-type Pokémon live? I'm afraid I'm not at all familiar with their habitats.
I wonder if those spectres I'm seeing from here are illusions created by ghost-type Pokémon.
I've never tried taming a ghost-type Pokémon before... I should explore this forest after the game.
Despite their appearance, ghost-type Pokémon are actually not any more dangerous than other types.
Does anyone fancy a quick swim after the game?
Does anyone fancy a quick swim after the game? We'll already be naked anyway.
Are we allowed to take a dip after the game? It's the quickest way for us to clean ourselves.
I hope the water in this place isn't too cold. It's a great way of cooling ourselves from the excitement of this game.
The prospect of jumping into the water is very tempting.
Oh, I-I d-didn't know it would be this type of a g-game, ~male~.
Is this your bedroom, ~male~?... You're n-not thinking of doing t-that with me, are you?
Why... i-is there a reason you brought me here, ~male~? This isn't what I e-expected.
I must say, this mansion is top-class. My villa doesn't even compare to this.
My villa in Undella Town is nothing to scoff at, but this mansion makes it look unremarkable in comparison.
This mansion reminds me of my summer villa at Undella Town. Speaking of which, I wonder what Jervis has been up to.
Don't be intimidated by my presence here. This is a poker game rather than a Pokémon battle, so I'd say you have a decent chance of beating me.
I may be the Sinnoh League Champion, but I don't think my skills would translate to strip poker. If anything, you might have a better chance of winning than me.
Strip poker - I don't think my years of experience as the Champion have done anything to prepare me for a possible defeat here.
If this was a battle, I would have already lost since we would only be allowed 6 Pokémon to fight with. Good thing this game allows 8 layers instead.
I may have lost 6 times already, but this game is a lot more forgiving than Pokémon battles, so I still have 3 defeats remaining before I'm out.
I... I don't think I've ever been naked in front of any of my Pokémon before... Not that I'd have a reason to...
Come to think of it, it would be weirder if I was naked in front of my Pokémon instead...
Is it common for people to stand naked in front of their Pokémon?... Why would you even do that?
Oh, it's very warm in here, not at all like Sinnoh. Wearing my coat was a mistake.
Perhaps I should have checked this place out first before bringing my coat with me. My summer blouse would have been more appropriate here.
This air reminds me of my home in Celestic Town. Ironically, this cold air is giving me a warm, fuzzy feeling.
This place might not be as cold as back home at Sinnoh, but I like it nonetheless.
Bringing my coat was the correct decision then. I don't think my summer blouse can handle this cold.
How is the Pokémon egg I gave you after your previous win, ~player~? I hope you are taking good care of it. Everyone Pokémon deserves to be loved by its owner.
{small} Are you loving the Pokémon egg I gave you during the previous game, ~player~? Meeting all the Pokémon is an accomplishment, and I only want to lend you a little hand, that's all.

{small} That Egg I gave you after your win is special, ~player~. An Egg is the cradle of every being. The planet itself is an Egg in a sense... Life that comes from an Egg will come to an end in due course... to begin anew...

{small} I hope that Egg I gave you previously will come in handy, ~player~. A Pokémon will hatch from it while you are traveling. I would be happy to know that it will help you fill another page of your Pokédex.
I hope my outfit isn't too dark for this location. It blends in somewhat with the shadows doesn't it?
Keep your eyes peeled. A dark-type Pokémon could be lurking in the shadows.
Is everyone sure this place is truly isolated? It would be very embarrassing if someone sees us playing strip poker in here.
I'm not exactly sure hosting strip poker here was a good idea. There might not be anybody currently here aside from us, but someone might end up walking into here.
The triple scoop cones are usually a good promo, but it might be more expensive here... and it is already expensive to begin with...
I have heard that they sell Inkay ink flavored ice cream here... no way such a flavor would be cheap though...
I haven't had strawberry ice cream for quite a while now... but it's so difficult to find non-artificially flavored ones...
I wonder... would they charge extra to add ice cream toppings...?
Do they sell Vanillish-shaped ice cream cones here? I haven't had one for years now.
What about I order a double scoop with two different flavors... But what flavors should I include...?
Why do they call it ice cream and not iced cream?
Is ice cream just a thinner gelato, or is gelato just thicker ice cream?
I wonder if she's thinking of ice cream or snowcones...
Oh, right... I haven't decided on an ice cream flavor yet... Now, what should it be?
I can order all of the available flavors... but where would I put them all...?

Great question! Even though it might seem like just a cockfight, Pokémon battles are completely different and it's not fair to compare the two.
I'm glad you asked, Streaming-chan. I'm also an archaeologist and historian, and my particular interest are creation myths. I know the creation myths of every region.
Unfortunately, yes. Due to their immense power, Pokémon have been used in deadly wars, both in the past and in the present. That's why owning Pokémon is a great responsibility.
I have to admit that I prefer an emotional bond over a physical one. It would be too early to tell if anyone in here is emotionally compatible with me. Perhaps, ~player~ could be a good fit.
S-s-sure... I don't see how it could harm anything... People have always been interested in my life even before I became the Champion of Sinnoh...
I'm more than just a master trainer, Streaming-chan. I'm the Sinnoh League Champion, which means I'm the best Pokémon trainer in the entire Sinnoh region.
I've definitely experienced a lot, Streaming-chan. I've been to almost very region that I know of, and I've even been to another dimension.
"Big milf energy"? I'm afraid I'm not familiar with that term.
As much as I would want to love all my Pokémon equally, it's hard to deny that Garchomp is my favorite out of all my Pokémon.
As a matter of fact, the first thing people remark when they see me as that I'm the League Champion. But yes, I also hear that often, Mary.
Oh, I don't use a whip on my Pokémon, Revy. I always treat them with utmost care and compassion. Pokémon are stronger when they are happy, you see.
I'm absolutely amazed that we have similar looking outfits despite hailing from different planets. Is that the usual outfit back at your home planet?
The fact that our outfits are remotely similar at all is very fascinating. Would that happen to be a common attire in your planet?
Well, I've wanted to try something new, and at the same time get out of my comfort zone, Nami.
I'm only a researcher, Akko; there's nothing really outstanding about me, other than that I'm pretty decent at Pokémon battles...
I guess I'm unsure what the question is... I'm just Pokémon trainer, Akko; in fact, it is you who I'm more unable to identify.
Don't be silly, Akko, I could never be cruel to my Pokémon! Why, I can't even imagine that.
Cruel? Me? You must be mistaken, Akko; trainers who are harsh to their Pokémon are undeserving of my respect.
Of course I mean it, Akko. Pokémon perform better at battles when they are happy, and I'm happy too when my Pokémon are happy.
It seems we hail from different countries, Maki. I came from Celestic Town, in the Sinnoh Region. I'm curious to know about your home country.
I'm happy that I remind you of your friend. This Eli friend of yours, what exactly about me reminds you of her?
One must always remember those who make us happy, regardless of who it is. By the way, I want to know how I remind you of your friend, Maki.
It's not that I'm competitive, Dust. It's just that I enjoy winning a lot.
Well, I wouldn't consider myself competitive. It's just that winning is very pleasing to me.
I'm glad you asked that, Meia. Men-women relationships have always been the cultural norm for as long as I remember, although men-to-men have also existed.
I just happen to have studied that, Meia. Even though men-to-men relationships have been acceptable at various eras, men and women have always been together.
To be honest, losing doesn't happen to me often. I don't mean to brag, but I've been undefeated in Pokémon battles for several years now.
Do you want to say something to me, Akko? Your stare is mildly discomforting.
Do you like my outfit, Kazuma? Some people have said that it makes me look like a traveler, but I can say the same for you.
I've heard that you're from a land where monsters roam freely, Kazuma. So do I, although our monsters are friendly.
Going back to the topic of Pokémon, Kazuma, it is very common for young kids to own and care many of them.
As I was saying about Pokémon, Kazuma, they are so friendly that young children will often collect them without danger.
If you want a change of pace, Kazuma, I could show you how to catch some Pokémon back at Unova.
I've been thinking about our trip, Kazuma. I can't even decide what to show you first. There's so many things you need to learn about Pokémon.
Haha! That might be true for Pokémon battles, Elesa, but strip poker is more of a luck-based game.
Well, there's always that possibility you'll finally defeat me at a battle, Elesa. You just need to train hard.
This is just beginner's jitters, I suppose. I can bounce back from this once I settle in.
I'm only getting started here, Elesa. It would be foolish to think that I'm already halfway out, even though technically I am.
I think you might be correct, Elesa. That doesn't stop me from enjoying this game though, and that's the most important thing.
Anticlimactic, Elesa? I'm just about to go naked here. I don't know about you, but I've never done this before.
Wait, you know me, Pit. How come? I don't believe we've met before.
Oh, that's because of the chilly weather back at Sinnoh. I would be freezing if I didn't have this coat with me all the time.
I'm glad you're as excited in meeting me as I am excited in meeting you, Pit.
Give up? I didn't give up, Pit. I just run out of luck this round, it would seem.
You've been an interesting companion so far, Pit. I'm learning a lot about angels from you.
It sure is, Megumin. This place isn't as cold as the Sinnoh region, but at least my coat spares me from embarrassment for this round.
A Champion like me is always prepared for the unexpected, Megumin. I have everything well under control here.
That sounds very poetic, Megumin. It reminds me of one of the inscriptions I found in a dig last week. Let's see if I can remember the words...
M-Megumin! That's not how you talk about my cow b-... I mean, my breasts!
If you're talking about extra articles of clothing, Megumin, then it's all you see right here. I only have my underwear left after this.
Oh, not this again, Megumin. I wish you'd stop describing my breasts like that.
I know, N. This game might be dominated by luck, but it still takes a bit of skill, and I wouldn't let-up no matter how bad things get.
I have played poker before, N, but they were just casual games with friends. This is the first time I'll be playing poker in a competitive scene.
If you want a very competitive game, N, then you're in luck, I'm just getting warming up to the game mechanics.
Are you trying to get in my head, N? That's quite the futile effort so far.
This game is just getting exciting! I can feel an extra gear in my pace.
I'm not upset, Guzma. I'm just surprised that I lost this round. And more importantly, I lost this round against you of all people.
I still have a chance of winning this, don't I, Guzma? I still have a lot of chances remaining.
I'm not panicking, if that's what you're implying, Guzma. I'm simply contemplating how I lost that round.
That's definitely not the case, Guzma. I still have one trick left to use, and I'm excited to see your face drop when you see it.
I still have two layers to go after this, Guzma. I would make you eat your words when I come back and win this game.
Ha! If you knew anything about me, it's that I don't panic regardless of the circumstances.
What's that, Guzma? Are you finally starting to respect my Champion status?
Yes, Shamir. I am Cynthia from the Sinnoh region, Pokémon League champion, esteemed mythological researcher, bane of Team Gala-
No heavy lifting"? Quite the opposite, Shamir. Being a Pokémon trainer requires years of dedication and mastery. It's one of the more difficult jobs in Sinnoh.
That sounds terrible, Shamir, but what do Pokémon have to do with this?
Well, Shamir... When you put it like that...
Just be careful not to overburden your Pokémon, Shamir. Ah, but who am I kidding. These are mere hypothetical inquiries.
No. Out of the question, Shamir. I will not support the introduction of Pokémon to a foreign land consumed by hardship.
Shamir, I think you'd be better off in pursuing peace through other means. You cannot expect your land to adapt so quickly to change; it takes time.
I'm not the seductive type at all, Jessie. As a matter of fact, I've never attempted to flirt with anyone before. Thanks for the compliments though.
Oh, you've completely misinterpreted my personality, Jessie. I'm definitely not a seductress at all. Looks can be quite deceiving.
As a matter of fact, I do travel often, Jessie. Some of them are for my archaeological studies, and others are for my obligation as the Sinnoh League Champion.
I have visited archaeological digs and museums all over the world, Jessie, and I have also traveled abroad for Pokémon Championship battles.
It is indeed quite cold in Sinnoh, Jessie. It snows five months per year, especially near Mt. Coronet. My coat is perfect for the weather.
My outfit is very necessary, Jessie, given the cold climate back at Sinnoh. It's rather convenient during the winter months.
Oh, I'm not actually living in Sinnoh right now, Jessie. I haven't visited my house in quite a while. My family do live there.
I might be the Sinnoh League Champion, Jessie, but I hardly stay there, let alone my house. I do visit my family once in a while.
I can't even remember the last time I went to my house. I usually just stay at Grandma's house when I visit.
Sure thing, Jessie. My family lives in Celestic Town, with my Grandma, Professor Carolina, running the Historical Research Center.
You're interested about my younger sister, Jessie? She lives in my family's home in Celestic Town, with my grandparents.
My younger sister and my Grandma Carolina live at the family home back at Celestic Town. I presume they visit the Ruins often.
I do travel often, but it's rarely an international trip, Jessie. Most of my battles are local to the Sinnoh region.
Most of my battles are against members of the Sinnoh Elite Four, so my travels are usually across cities, Jessie.
You're correct, Jessie. I would say my travels began when I was just a child, and I was filling up my Pokédex.
Yes, I did start adventuring shortly after I received my Pokédex. I was eager to get as many entries as I can.
... I do receive a lot of offers like that, Jessie. I just reject all of them without a second thought. Is that a common thing?
... I was very surprised when it happened for the first time, but I'm now used to turning them down, Jessie.
I'm the Sinnoh League Champion, Sayaka. I'm the best in the Sinnoh region in terms of battling Pocket Monsters, or Pokémon for short.
I might not be magical, but my Pokémon are very powerful, so I think I can hold my own just fine, Sayaka.
Is there anything you wanted to know about Pokémon, Sayaka? I've noticed that you seem particularly interested in them.
I'm interested in the witches you fight, Sayaka. We have our Hex Maniacs, but they keep to themselves and are relatively harmless compared to your witches.
Pokémon have always been a important part of culture and mythology throughout human history, Sayaka. Humans and Pokémon are practically inseparable by this point.
Expectations on you must be really high, Sayaka, based on what people that have previously been in your position have accomplished.
I don't mean to brag, but I'm quite well-known in Sinnoh even though I'm not in the history books yet, Sayaka.
Is there something in your mind that you want to ask me, Sayaka? Mythology, battling, I can answer anything you ask.
I might be an important person, but that doesn't mean I have to play in the VIP table only. Meeting anybody and everybody is what I came here for, Shantae.
I suppose this can be the VIP table if everyone has the self-confidence. But, to be serious, I came here just to socialize, Shantae.
Is that so, Megumin? How exactly does my outfit differ from your village's attire, if I may ask?
That's an interesting comparison, Megumin. What kind of changes would you suggest?
Is that truly the case, Megumin? I know I receive some rather intimate proposals from some of my fans, both men and female, but that's normal for everybody, isn't it?
I wouldn't say so, Megumin. I'm aware that I'm one of the most popular Pokémon trainers, being Champion and all, but I know that other Pokémon trainers have their own legions of fans.
Is something the matter, Tomoko? You're quite deep in thought.
Looks like you're contemplating something, Tomoko...
Oh, I train Pokémon, Komi, not Sokemon. Besides, I've never heard of a "Sokechuu" or "Soke-OL"...
You misheard me, Komi. I train Pokémon rather than Sokemon. I'm also unfamiliar with the names you enumerated.
Is something the matter, Saki? You look pretty glum all of a sudden.
Is there anything bothering your mind right now, Saki?
I did, Miko? Why precisely would that be the case? I'm assuming you have some useful historical trivia to share with me.
That's definitely me you're describing, Miko, but I can't grasp how being in a table with you would be lucky for my profession.
What's so nerdy about Pokémon, Saki? People from all over the world and from all walks of life are taking care of Pokémon...
Nerdy... How is raising and training a Pokémon supposed to be nerdy, Saki?
That's a very rude way of describing a Squirtle, Saki! Squirtles have feeling too, you know.
You shouldn't be bad-mouthing Squirtles just because they're Pokémon rather than Humans, Saki.
Sinnoh does have some... gaps in terms of historical knowledge, and it was one of my motivations for becoming an archaeologist and historian.
Sinnoh can be somewhat lacking when it comes to preserving history, hence why archaeology is such a big deal, for me at least.
Most of the modern religions can be traced back to mythological roots, Meia. The worship of Arceus, for example, originates from Sinnoh's creation story.
A large percentage of the world's population follows a religion, Meia, and almost every religion originated from a creation story. In Sinnoh in particular, this is how the worship of Arceus began.
Well, my hairpieces have the same story as you, Neptune. Although, mine is evocative of a Lucario.
Aside from reminding me of my Lucario, these hairpieces doesn't have special properties, Neptune.
I've never heard of Lastation before, Neptune, but I'm from the Sinnoh region. It's quite cold there, hence the coat and scarf.
I'm afraid I don't know where Lastation is, Neptune. Anyway, I'm from the Sinnoh region, and the local weather necessitated me to wear a warm coat.
Pokémon training is one of the most common hobbies, Meia. Everyone from 10 years olds to professionals like doctor, reporters, and policemen have a Pokémon they are training.
The majority of people I know train Pokémon, Meia, although not everybody do so as their main occupation. Young teenagers, and even working professionals would train Pokémon in their spare time.
They were Pokémon battle championships, Pyrrha. I became the League Champion by besting all the trainers in Pokémon battles, and I've successfully defended my title against all challengers so far.
I'm basically the Champion of Pokémon battles in the Sinnoh League, Pyrrha. I've proven myself to have the strongest Pokémon team in Sinnoh, and I've continued to defend my title.

Normally when I wake up, I would go biking for an hour, then I would read up on manuscripts until noon. After lunch, I would tour around the Celestic Ruins, and perhaps meet up with some of the gym leaders along the way.

I'm glad you asked, Jim. Well, Pokémon are the creatures that live among humans in some regions of the world. They can take various shapes and sizes, live in different ecosystems, and have varying powers.

I'm surprised you haven't seen a Pokémon before, Jim. Anyway, Pokémon are the creatures that either live in the wild and domesticated by humans. Every environment have Pokémon inhabiting it, which influences the type of powers they can possess.
A strike? What is this strike that you're talking about, Galatea? Also, this coat is toasty but it's not uncomfortably hot.
I... don't really understand what you meant by that, Galatea. I doubt I've been cursed by any deities recently. Regarding my coat, it's rather fit for this temperature.
Historians and archaeologist come in all shapes and forms is what I can say. For some reason, people expect archaeologists to wear leather jackets and fedoras.
Is there a stereotypical "historian" outfit you're thinking of, Galatea? I've seen all sorts of outfits worn by historians.
Oh, yes please! Attending this game would turn out to be more productive than I thought! Tell me everything that you know, Galatea!
Well, at this rate, I might forget about this game and just spend all of it listen to your narration, Galatea!
Gods of music and creation... Yes, I see. I seem to recall Burgh mentioning a God of Art... Perhaps I should talk to him about that...
I seem to have... foggy memories of Burgh mentioning something similar during one of his artists blocks... It seems a visit to his studio in Unova would be of high priority...
I think there's just one more detail about the Greek mythology that I want to know, Galatea. Where did humans come in? Where they created at the same time as the deities?
There's still one valuable piece of information that would be useful to my studies, Galatea. Where the gods responsible for the creation of humans?
I don't think I recall anything about the origins of humankind. Would you happen to know the details of that, Galatea?

I'm trying to study the history and pantheons all over the world so that I can get a full picture of how this world was created, Galatea. It would be the key to understanding the forces that made this world.

I have a fascination with creation stories, Galatea, but I noticed that they tend to contradict each other. I'm learning as many creations stories as I can so that I can piece together what really happened that led to the existence of this world.

I've always been fascinated by the Sinnohlian creation story, but I was unsatisfied by the contradictions with the creation stories of other regions. I hope that by examining the similarities, I might create a clearer timeline of this world's creation.

I suppose you can say that being the Sinnoh League Champion and having my name recorded in the Hall of Fame is my legacy... But I also want to be remembered as a very influential historian - the one who solved the mystery of the world's creation.

I'm not really chasing a legacy per se, but if my study of the world's creation and the stories and beliefs surrounding it leads to it, then why would I turn down such a thing. If I solve the mysteries of the world's creation, then that shall be my legacy.

My current legacy is being the best trainer in Sinnoh, but should I succeed in figuring out how the world was created, then that would be my greatest legacy. But my goal is knowing how this world came to be; the legacy is just secondary.
I wouldn't say I follow any special diet routine, Erufuda. I do follow a well-balanced diet, and I try to avoid greasy and starchy foods as much as I can.
I don't really do anything special to maintain my figure, Erufuda. I do eat a balanced diet of meat and crops, and only eat sweets and fried foods in moderation.
Being champion doesn't actually necessitate me to do workouts, Erufuda. Although, I do go biking in my spare time. I even join in some amateur cycling competitions.
I can't see why not, Erufuda. This outfit came in different sizes, and the largest size should be able to fit you, at the very least.
Surely, you would be able to fit in a coat like this, Erufuda. The pants and shirt might be a bit more troublesome for you, but some of the largest sizes should be at least enough to fit you.
Well, I do think eating ice cream is fine if you're not dealing with weight issues, Erufuda. Anyway, my favorite flavor of ice cream is... Hmm... Let me think of it first...
Unless you're overweight, or need to stick to a certain weight, eating ice cream in moderation is good. Speaking of good, my favorite flavor is... Hang on, I have to decide a bit...
Well... I do expend a lot of effort at keeping my appearance neat and organized, so it's nice to hear that my efforts didn't go to waste.
Thanks for the compliment, Deimos. My appearance didn't just create itself, you know. Maintaining a good hygiene, and wearing appropriate clothing can do wonders for one's appearance.

Wild Pokémon aren't usually a problem since they are usually weak, and they don't just attack people out of the blue either. It's the Pokémon under the control of shady groups that are the bigger concern, Jim.
Despite their rather intimidating appearance, most Pokémon are quite docile. It mostly depends upon the intentions of the owner, and some trainers have rather... malicious intentions, Jim.
Why, I'm the Sinnoh League Champion, Yusuke. What that basically means is that I'm the best Pokémon trainer in all of the Sinnoh Region!
I'm none other than the Champion of the Sinnoh Region's Pokémon League. Through a series of battles, I proved myself as the best trainer in the region, and have successfully defended my title.
Many regions around the world use the term "Pokémon", so I suppose you had heard of it at some point in the past, Yusuke.
Considering how prevalent the usage of the term "Pokémon" is, I suspect you've encountered the word, but you've simply lost the memory.

The most powerful of my Pokémon? I would say my Garchomp is the most formidable member of my team. Garchomps are naturally strong and powerful, but my Garchomp is still stronger than most would expect.
Among all the Pokémon I have at my disposal, I would say Garchomp is the one that I have come to rely on the most. She's always there when I need her.
Well, I'm glad at least one of us is enjoying this predicament, Yusuke...
I can't say I can make the same claim, Yusuke...
It was meant to be, Yusuke. But at this point in the game, I realized that I need to step up or else I'll end up naked... or worse... I believe I can still win this...
On one hand, I'm supposed to be enjoying this game. On the other hand, I can't fully enjoy a game unless I'm being competitive in it. So... here we are...
I'm more than just a great trainer: I also happen to be a historian and archaeologist, Yusuke. I often use my popularity to beseech my fans to support the local museums and history centers.
I also aspire to be as successful as a historian as I am a Champion. Just like art, folklore and artifacts deserves to be preserved and remembered, to be appreciated and admired.
Oh, I've been quite busy in my work both as a trainer and as a historian, so I've barely had the time recently, Jura. Besides, I would be looking for a boyfriend rather than a girlfriend.
I'm so busy lately, I've barely had the time to take a break, let alone get a date, Jura. I don't know about a girlfriend, but finding a boyfriend takes some time.
Sinnoh is located just north of the Johto and Kanto regions, Yuri. If you've heard of Mount Coronet, then that's where the Sinnoh region is.
Sinnoh is further north compared to regions such as Johto, Kanto, and Hoenn, Yuri. It's a common winter destination for tourists, particularly Mount Coronet.
Well... the only Pokémon I brought with me to this place was Garchomp, and... I wouldn't want to cause a scene by having my Garchomp march about in a place like this.
I didn't feel the need to bring any of my Pokémon aside from my Garchomp... and I don't think Garchomp is the type of Pokémon you'd want to pet anyway.
I could bring out my Garchomp right now, but it might disrupt the game too much if I did. Not to mention that she's not quite a "cute" Pokémon to begin with.
Oh, they're not literally Pocket Monsters, Perona. Rather, they're kept in Pokéballs, which are then kept in pockets. Most Pokémon are too big to fit in pockets.
You misunderstood what Pokémon are, Perona. They're called Pocket Monsters because they can be kept in pockets when inside a Pokéball. Most Pokémon are actually quite large.
We don't just make "monsters" fight each other, Orendi. We catch them, train them, love them, and make them stronger. I don't think you have quite the same plan in mind, though.

There's more to Pokémon training than just making them commit mindless acts of violence, Orendi. Training a Pokémon is just like raising a child in many aspects. You don't just make them punch each other just because you will it.
Oh, I've been doing fine, Misty! Well... up until now, that is...
Things have been great, Misty! Have you heard about the newly discovered Galar region? We should make our way there and explore it together!
Do you think you can teach me about this Duel Monsters card game, Chazz? I'm always eager to learn about this kind of stuff.
Would now be a good time to inform me about Duel Monsters, Chazz? I try to learn everything I can about mythology and folklore!
... This isn't the start I had in mind...

There are indeed plenty of types of Pokémon out there. From the type of my mind, there are the fighting-types, psychic-types, dark-types, dragon-types, bug-types, fairy-types, and plenty more.
I see. I'd say that your artist played a very risky game, going by the number of myths I've read of gods punishing humans for speaking ill of them.
I can understand venting your anger on unseen forces, but based on the stories and accounts I've read, bad-mouthing the gods can have some dire consequences.
That's quite fascinating! Humans being borne out of clay and dirt and earth... It's a common theme in many cultural creation myths, just like the myth of the great flood!

The clay creation myth - it never ceases to amaze me how cultures on opposite ends of the globe can have such common themes in their myths. The only other myth that are as prevalent is the Great Deluge myth.
I might not be able to completely decipher the mechanisms of the world's creation, but at the very least, I plan the pave the way for future historians who aspire to do the same thing.
Just like how creation myths are passed down through the generations, my discoveries and theories will be passed down and be appended upon by future historians, if all goes well.

...Hmm, perhaps that's what I've been missing all along: the divine blessing. All the writers and philosophers who have left their indelible mark in history considered themselves as blessed by the gods.

...Perhaps it would the favor of the gods that would allow me to complete the story that I seek. It's probably not a coincidence that the best writers throughout history all credit their talents to divine provenance.
Well, I heard of this place through the grapevine, and I felt that I ought to try something different while I'm in the area, so I joined this game.
I wanted a little break from my daily routine, and I felt playing a strip poker game, which I've never done before, would be a good change of pace.
... Could it be? Are you talking about my Lucario? I haven't seen him in weeks! Now, tell me how he did in that particular battle.

Despite her intimidating looks and near-unstoppable power, Garchomp is actually quite gentle and knows how to handle her strength properly.
Oh, looks can be quite deceiving indeed. Despite what her appearance might suggest, Garchomp is actually quite friendly. She's rather fond of being patted by children.
... Does this tie in to the nude modeling sometimes utilized during the creation of art pieces... This is quite an unusual place to do such a thing, don't you think?

I can understand what you mean. Far too often, I find myself trying to win a sparring match. It's not easy letting off when you're used to being in full throttle all the time.
I understand that some things are simply not meant to be taken seriously. But it's just so easy to get into that mindset, the mindset that you use to win battles.

There was that one young trainer that had a relatively easy time defeating the Elite Four. Not only did the child have a strong team, but also a entire bagful of items. If it weren't for all my Full Restores and my Garchomp, I surely would have lost that battle.

I still remember that young trainer, who walked into the champion's room with the most intense pair of eyes I've ever seen. Even the Elite Four were no match for that kid. I managed to snag the victory by having my Garchomp do an Earthquake.

Not at all, Pyrrha. I enjoy both activities, especially since it allows me to meet new people and new challenges. Although, when I do get tired of the routine, I would go on vacations to different regions around the world.
It's not as repetitive as you might think, Pyrrha, as each day can present a different situation. However, in the event that I do get fatigued, I would travel to different regions.

I find your intentions and ethics to be rather questionable, Orendi... but very well, if you're really curious about how you can make your Pokémon stronger and learn more moves, then I suppose it wouldn't hurt if I give the details. You see, there are several types of Pokémon, and their types play a huge role in determining the moves that they can learn. Of course, this doesn't mean that Pokémon of the same types will have the same move set, but instead they will have the same pool of moves that they can learn. And another point I must make is that an individual Pokémon species can have its own unique move sets, and learning those will require familiarity with the Pokémon in particular. Anyhow, teaching a Pokémon a new move requires a lot of practice and repetition. A Pokémon instinctively knows there moves, but it is quite unrefined, which is why repetitions are so pivotal. Although, in the context of you, which in this case are Valresi punching each other, that would be rather easy to teach them, don't you think? I'm not familiar with how Valresi can adapt to teaching, but I would suppose the bigger obstacle would be taming them in the first place. And then after that, you would have to take into account their injuries. Pokémon centers are adept at healing Pokémon injured in battles, but I don't know if the same can be performed for the Valresi. Hmm... quite intriguing indeed. Anyway, I suppose that covers all the basics... Oh! I forgot another thing: when a Pokémon evolves, they usually have a different move set than that of their previous form... Come to think of it, that might not be applicable in your case... Anyway, that's all I have to say on the topic. I hope I was quite clear on the subject matter. Do you have any questions, Orendi?

I have a rather ominous feeling as to your goals with this knowledge, but I suppose keeping you informed will not hurt, Orendi. As for your question, how does a Pokémon learn a new move? Well, one thing that will always make your Pokémon - and people in general - better at a certain skill is training. You see, you don't just get good at a certain skill right of the bat. You have to train hard to master it. Not only does it help you develop your muscle memory, but it also makes you physically stronger overall, which in turn makes you better at performing said task. You see how it's all a cycle? Anyway, one of the ways a Pokémon can master their skill is by participating in battle. It all makes sense, doesn't it? The more often you use a move in a meaningful environment, the better it will get. Of course, one downside of battling all the time is that your Pokémon is more likely to get injured, so battling might be the most effective way of gaining a skill, but it's not the only option. Another option you have is to spar with another trainer. Of course, you would ask abut the difference between sparring and battling. Well, in battling, the goal is to make your opponent faint. In sparring, you are using controlled moves; controlled in such a way that you don't do damage to the other Pokémon, but you are still using the move. See how it ties up to what I said earlier about training? Anyway, your Pokémon get better with the skill being practiced, and the other Pokémon is also getting stronger because it is "defending" against your attacks. You're mutually benefiting from this setup. Of course, this is not as effective as being in actual battles, but the effect is pretty noticeable. And then, you can choose the third option: obtaining a Z-ring. You can easily find a Z-ring in the Alola region, or so I've been told, and wielding a Z-ring gives your Pokémon a powerful move tied in with the Z-ring. But that's quite the easy way out, isn't it? Anyway, that concludes my lecture. Did you catch all of that, Orendi, or do you want me to repeat it all over again?
I don't do anything particularly special to maintain my hair like this, Deimos. I happen to have a friend that has even way more hair than I do, yet her hair is still immaculate.

This is my trump card; my coat and scarf counted as separate layers.
Unlike my coat, this scarf doesn't actually insulate heat that well. It's purely for aesthetic purposes.

This is my favorite sex story from any ancient manuscripts I've read. I must warn all of you that the language is quite coarse and vulgar, but this game is vulgar anyway, so I suppose there's no need to tone down the language. Anyhow, here it goes: "
I will sodomize you and face-fuck you,
cocksucker Aurelius and bottom bitch Furius,
who think, from my little verses,
because they're a little soft, that I have no shame.
For it is right for the devoted poet to be chaste
himself, but it's not necessary for his verses to be so.
Verses which then indeed have taste and charm,
If they are delicate and have no shame,
And because they can incite an itch,
And I don't mean in boys, but in
Those hairy men who can't move their loins.
You, because about my many thousands of kisses
You've read, you think me less of a man?
I will sodomize you and face-fuck you."
It was a desperate situation, Streaming-chan. I wouldn't even think of doing anything like that in any other situation.
Heh... I wouldn't count that possibility out entirely...
There are people who have had sex with Pokémon, but they are sexual deviants! Nobody in their right mind would even think of doing such a thing!
Based on that expression, I'd say yes.
Oh, I didn't mean it like that! We... we were sharing beds after a long trip and we weren't fooling around in bed or anything... We just slept next to each other...
Oh, sorry about the outburst back there. As for your question, I don't have a child. I haven't even done that yet with a man...
Would you mind if I continue? Anyway, my first battle was with Gible. Every battle I've had, she was part of my party. She made Garchomp a popular Pokémon among Sinnohlians.

To elaborate on that, when this world was made, Dialga and Palkia appeared. Apparently, there was one more Pokémon that appeared at the same time. A Pokémon with as much power as Dialga and Palkia... But also one whose name was never to be spoken--Giratina! It's said to lurk in another world... A world on the opposite side of ours...It's said that in the Distortion World, neither time nor space were stable. I think that tells us something about Giratina, the only Pokémon there. It must have been as powerful as Dialga and Palkia, the rulers of time and space. In some way, though, Giratina has to have a power opposite of theirs. I'm sorry this is so long. May I say one last bit? Dialga's Roar of Time...Palkia's Spacial Rend...To the people back then, those Pokémon really must have appeared to rule over time and space. Seeing them must have shaken the people to their very core. Those feelings of awe, wonder, and everything else. It passed that memory to countless people, eventually becoming a myth...That's what I believe as a researcher of myths. I think I let myself get carried away and talked for far too long. I'm sorry, and thank you.
There's no need to be hostile, Akko! I'm not cruel to my Pokémon. I always make sure that they are happy to be with me.

Oh, thanks for that advice... Wait, are you talking to me or to yourself, my angel?

My travels expose me to the cultures of other regions. And with that, I learn more about their mythology.
When I have the free time during one of those trips, I try to learn more about the local creation myths.
I also get to further my research by looking at the local culture, and reconciling them with my previous findings.
What makes a Pokédex even more special is that it is only given to the most promising trainers in each region.
Having a near-complete Pokédex is very rare indeed, and I feel honored at being one of the few people to accomplish it.
Just having an expansive Pokédex is already an accomplishment by itself, and is a mark of a great trainer.
No thanks, Jessie. I'm up for trying new things, but that's not one those things I'm keen on even thinking about.

You don't understand. It's less of a fight, and more of an exercise for Pokémon. It's part of the process of making them stronger.
Think of it less as a fight to the death, and more of a sparring session. The goal is to make Pokémon stronger without severely injuring them.
Not making Pokémon fight actually hurts them in the long-term. Controlled battle sessions is the best way of making a Pokémon stronger and more fit.
There were some cultures where women had an equal social standing with men, but the majority of cultures are male-centric, so to speak.
I can recite some cultures that had equal gender rights, but most past cultures are undoubtedly controlled by men.
Pokémon are more of living entities than familiars. I don't actually directly control them. I just give them orders, and they obey me.

Hold on, this is what you wanted to the from the beginning, did you?
What's even the point of joining a strip poker game if you're just playing to lose immediately?
This game might be about nudity, but that doesn't excuse your desire to show your crotch to unsuspecting people, ~name~.
~Name~ is really going to reveal her... Oh, things have gotten interesting.
How are you losing your ~clothing~ already? Do you even know how to play poker?
Even for a game decided by randomness, this is such an unfortunate outcome for you.
Nobody can be this unlucky! I can hardly believe this!
Are you doing this intentionally, ~name~? Is this your idea of a distraction, or are you really this unlucky?
This game is getting really heated now, huh. Nobody is safe.
If you think about it, this is the only thing distinguishing men and women, biologically.
Feminine hygiene is very important and shouldn't be overlooked. Let's see how well you've been maintaining your hygiene.
Are you the type of woman who shaves, or not? Only one way to find out.
No turning back now, ~name~. You have to fulfill the consequences of your defeat.
Your ~clothing~ doesn't look cheap. I suppose wearing ~clothing.ifPlural(|a)~ cheap ~clothing~ wouldn't be a good showing.
Even though it has come down to this, you still did pretty well. I had mistaken you for an easy opponent, but you've proven me absolutely wrong.
You've been looking at mine, ~name~. It's time you show us yours.
I know you're in a bad spot right now, but it least you're not down to doing this yet.
Can you remove your ~clothing~ slowly, ~name~? Ironically, it would help me finish faster.
Hair or not, the sight of your vulva would really push me to the limit.
This accomplishment doesn't feel quite as good when it's pretty much handed to me.
What makes an achievement truly rewarding is the sheer effort it takes to accomplish it. I can't say the same when you wanted to be naked in the first place.
I bet you're just absolutely thrilled to be naked in front of everybody, ~name~.
You're not wearing any underwear down there? How do you keep the moisture from spreading?
Huh, you weren't wearing underwear? Wouldn't that cause it to dry out?
Do you usually not wear underwear, or did you run out of clean underwear, ~name~?
Oops, looks like someone's been falling short on their upkeep!
It looks like someone's falling behind on maintenance.
Is that... Supposed to be a look? Or...
Is that... Supposed to be a look? Or have you just been falling behind on maintenance?
Isn't it healthier to shave? Or... Well, I don't know what the health professionals are saying these days.
Isn't it healthier to shave? Or... Well, I don't know what Nurse Joy is saying anymore these days.
A vagina! Ah, bu-but why... (Why am I liking this?)
Oh... (Why is this turning me on? )
A vagina! Ah, bu-but why... (Why is this turning me on?)
Oh, I-I'm not normally into these, but... I'm finding this sight to be helpful.
Oh my, that looks... Quite wet.
Oh... (why... why is this getting me wet?)
I suppose it's the... excitement of the situation that's making me a bit wet...
I know she's not out yet, but this is almost like a victory itself!
It doesn't feel right somehow that you're already at this point while I'm still fully covered.
(Maybe this table was a little too easy...)
Perhaps coming in with this many pieces of clothing wasn't necessary at all. But then again, this is just my normal attire.
This would be quite the uphill battle for you, ~name~, but you can still come back from this. Anything can happen in a game of chance!
I still have a couple of layers to spare before I would have to do the same, but I can't let myself get overconfident.
I do hope there aren't any thieves lurking around here. It would be a shame if someone stole your ~clothing~.
It's so brave of you to remove your ~clothing~ in front of a crowd. Not everyone has the courage to do it.
Use this as a motivation to do better, ~name~. I know you wouldn't want to lose again, considering the consequences.
There's no need to make this even more awkward than it already is, although I don't mind the scenery.
What an erotic sight... Did I just say that out loud?
(Staring at ~name~'s... It's making mine warm and tingly...)
Oh yes! So similar yet so different...
Are you wet, ~name~? I was doing this for myself, but if you like it as well...
(Perhaps if I invite, ~name~... No, I don't think she'll accept.)
Just looking at it... I can barely control my thoughts anymore...
Are you really in your mid-30s, Jessie? It seems hardly believable given your youthful appearance.
You look young for a woman in her 30s, Jessie. I almost look older than you!
So you must be... well-experienced in the adult movie industry, Jessie. I'm just curious what prompted you take an unconventional career path.
I can't say I've met a porn actress before, let alone a veteran. Any particular reason you chose that occupation, Jessie?
I know you're used to doing it everyday, Jessie, but can I ask if you still remember your first time? What did you feel at the time?
This might be a bit personal, Jessie, but I'm interested in knowing if you could still remember the feeling of losing your virginity.
I understand, from what I've heard so far, that you are rather adept at attracting men, Jessie. Can you share your secrets with me?
I take it that it is relatively easy for you to gain a man's attention, Jessie. I am curious about how you accomplish that.
I... I'm not leering at you, if that's what you're implying, Jessie... I was just... making sure you follow the rules.
That... that wasn't why I was staring at you, Jessie... I was checking if you had more than one layer remaining to strip.
I seem to recall it being mentioned earlier that you're a member of a book club, Yuri. Say, do you happen to discuss folklore in your club, especially creation stories?
I can't say I've ever met a member of a book club before, Yuri. I don't suppose it would be unreasonable to assume that your book club has discussed at least one creation story at some point?
Oh, ~player~! We look so much alike that we could pass off as brother and sister! That would be awkward in a game like this, though.
Are we long lost siblings, ~player~? No wonder the dealer asked me about that.
Oh, ~player~! We look so much alike that we could pass off as twins. Our resemblance is uncanny.
Are we long lost twins, ~player~? No wonder the dealer asked me about my sister.
Wow, ~player~, we look so much alike that you might as well be my doppelganger.
Oh, pardon the interruption, but I just noticed that you look like Lucian, from the Sinnoh Elite Four. You might not know him, but I guarantee that you look like him.
You look just like Lucian, ~name~... Oh, right, you might not be familiar with the Sinnoh Elite Four members. Anyhow, just like you, he has purple hair, and wears glasses and formal suits.
Your hair reminds me of Team Galactic grunts, ~player~. Not exactly the type of memories I'd want to remember in a time like this... or ever.
Blue ear-length hair... Ever heard of Team Galactic, ~player~? The group that tried to destroy the Sinnoh region? They all had that same hairstyle for some reason.
That hairstyle... it's so emblematic of Team Galactic grunts... Oh, don't worry, I know you're not one of them.
Oh, forgive me for staring, ~player~! Your appearance reminded me of Alder, the Champion of the Unova League... Wait, is he still the Champion?
Alder?!... Silly me, I momentarily forgot that you were there, ~player~. My head is in the clouds again. I was just surprised by the uncanny resemblance.
For a split second there, I thought you were Alder, ~player~. You're just the second long red-haired man I've ever met.
Ohoho, it's a Fantina look-alike. At least, I would consider you as one, ~name~. I have to say, your hair isn't as unique as hers, though.
Did you model your appearance after Fantina, ~name~? You know Fantina, right? The shadow-type gym leader of Sinnoh? Purple hair, purple eyes, purple dress. Doesn't ring a bell yet?
I haven't seen a magical person that angry since Caitlin learned how to control her psychic powers.
Your... your eyes are red, ~player~. Do you have sore eyes? I have some eyedrops you can borrow.
Are your eyes okay, ~player~? They seem unnaturally reddened.
Your hair is getting quite long, ~player~. Not to intrude on your space, but I think you might look better with shorter hair.
It's not often I meet men with hair that long. I bet you'd look more handsome with your hair cut short, if you want my advice, ~player~.
It's pretty rare meeting a man with hair as long as yours, ~player~. I suppose the haircare is just the same.
Is long hair the norm for men of your culture, ~player~? That's pretty rare indeed, even looking back at past cultures.
I can't believe how long your hair is, ~player~! It's even longer than mine!
Alright, this is a new one for me. I don't think I've ever seen a man with hair that reaches the floor. Women, sure, but never a man.
That's the longest hair I've seen from a person... How do you manage to take care of hair that long, ~player~?
Your hair looks like you could accidentally step on it, ~player~! I can't imagine how annoying it would be to accidentally step on my own hair.
Well, would you look at that: we have the same outfit scheme, Jotaro. What are the odds of that happening?
I'm not sure if you have noticed earlier, but we're wearing matching outfits. We have the same taste in clothes, it would seem.
A space traveler dressed like a Clefable... I've seen a lot, but I don't think I've seen anything like this.
You're Meia, right? The space traveler from what I've heard. I didn't expect you to be wearing a costume inspired by Clefable.

I take it that you don't have Pokémon in your colony, Meia. Very interesting that the image of Clefable persisted through your culture even if the source has long been forgotten. That's just how traditions work.

Since you have no Pokémon in your colony, then that would mean that the idea for this "Cupid" of yours originated from before your ancestors left this planet, and has simply been passed down through the generations.
I've been studying about the role of trading ships in spreading culture way back in the past... I want to ask if you've noticed this occurrence in your crew, Nami.
Have you noticed a mix of different cultures among your crew members, Nami? I'm interested if the same phenomenon might have occurred in the past.
My study is about the influence of trading ships in shaping a region's culture, Nami, and I just wanted to ask if your ship has clashing cultures among it's ranks.
Oh, I just thought of another thing to ask you, Nami! I'm curious as to how you mentally cope with long journeys in the ocean. I've read that it causes... unusual behavior in some people.
I hope you don't mind another question, Nami. This time, I'm curious about the psychological impact of ocean travel. I've heard that not everybody can cope with it.
This is the first time I've met an actual maritime pirate, and there are many things I want to know. Let's see... Oh, how exactly do you choose which ships to hijack?
This might be the only time I get to converse with a pirate, so I have to make the most of it... I'm curious as to how you plan which ships to attack, Nami.
I hope you don't mind even more questions from me, seeing that this could be my only meeting with a pirate... What's your process for planning your next victim?
It must be very nerve-racking being part of a ship crew, Nami. Aside from the unpredictable weather and risk of starvation, you must also keep an eye out for pirates.
There's just so many things that could go wrong in a trans-oceanic travel, and not all can be prepared for. Such as pirate attacks, they could happen anywhere, anytime.
That skin... It has the appearance of marble, as if you're a living statue...
I must say, your skin reminds me of an ancient marble statue...

condition.saying: I was still trapped within the stone

case.state: What is the oldest memory you can remember, Galatea? Do you have memories of Arceus breathing life into you?
I'm dying to know how far back you can remember things, Galatea. Can you remember when Arceus brought you into consciousness?
A knight? In this day and age? There was that Elite Four member from Kalos... Anyway, where did you say you originated from, Catria? Are there more knights like you where you're from?
A knight seems rather anachronistic at this point in time... Oh, don't let me hold you up, Catria! I was just wondering if knights are common in your place of origin, wherever that might be.
Are you... streaming this game?! Would you mind pointing the camera away from my direction? I wasn't prepared for this type of... exposure...
That doesn't happen to be a webcam on your cap, does it?! I would appreciate it if you keep my face out of the view of your camera.
Oh my, are you recording all of this?! Would you mind... keeping me out of the shot? I'd rather not people find out about my participation in this game.

condition.saying: If you are correct in that I am without purpose

case.state: I've been thinking about it, Galatea, and I think the reason Arceus erased your memory before turning you to stone was to remove your final vestiges of humanity, and render you as nothing more than an undying slab of rock.

Now that I've taken some time to ponder, it makes perfect sense that Arceus removed your memories, Galatea. It wanted you to be a lost soul, undying yet with no apparent purpose in life. Forever wandering, but no destination in sight.

If Arceus wanted you to be miserable and remorseful, then leaving you no memories surely achieved the goal. Not only did it detach you from your past as a human, it also left you with nothing to return to, nobody to ask for help, and no joy in life.
Hmm, I didn't expect to meet a Hex Maniac in a game like this. I've heard that they can be quite antisocial, but you're quite bubbly and sociable.
Well, what a pleasant surprise. It's been quite a while since I've met a Hex Maniac, but I can definitely tell you're one of them, Akko. Though, you're quite energetic for one.
What an interesting outfit. It does looks like the type of outfit that would be common three centuries ago. Is that what it's supposed to be, Sayaka?
Sayaka, your outfit looks similar to one of our outfit pieces in the historical research center back home. I don't suppose that was your intention though - wearing old-school clothing.
Hmm, you're the silent, intelligent type, aren't you? Oh, forgive me for taking assumptions about your personality, Komi, but that was the first impression I got.
I'm trying to judge your personality, Komi, and I'm getting the feeling that you're quite intelligent despite your silent demeanor.
Come on, N, you should really know what you're getting yourself into...
What, you didn't read the rules, N? That's on you, N; you need to be prepared!
Guzma... You may be familiar with Team Galactic from Sinnoh; they've attempted to destroy the universe... If your Team Skull is in any way similar, know that I won't hold back.
I hope you'll excuse my alertness, Guzma; Team Galactic has taught me that I cannot become complacent when criminals organize...
Guzma, if you're to expect any restraint from me, you must be clear what you're involvement with Team Skull is; what are your plans?
But of course, Chazz, I didn't expect these mythology lessons to be one-sided! I'll tell you all about the creation of our universe, as known throughout Sinnoh.
Come on, Chazz, I'm very interested in hearing about the mythology of Duel Monsters! I'll even tell you about Sinnoh's mythology... Might that be a trade?
Now, after Arceus, we start getting into the creation of the physical world as we know it; you might want to listen up.
Now that the physical world has been created through Arceus, Dialga, and Palkia, we start getting into the metaphysical.
Now that the physical world has been created through Arceus, Dialga, and Palkia, we still don't have any emotions, or characteristics!
You got off lucky these last few rounds, Catria; there's still a game underfoot!
You got off lucky these last few rounds, Catria; there's still a game underfoot, and I intend to win!
From what I've gathered so far, you've been to space, Meia. My grandma always told me how much of an enormous achievement it was when humans first traveled to space, and the moon.
I didn't think I'd meet a space traveler in a game like this. People from the older generations, mostly my grandma, would often compare ancient historical events to the first spaceflight.
Come to think of it, I don't think I've read much about female space travelers. But then again, I haven't read much about space travelers in general...
How many women have traveled to space anyway? I have heard of men traveling to space, but I can't recall much about women doing the same...
Did you say that you're a space traveler? Your outfit is more fitting for a model, as it looks nothing like a spacesuit at all. Were you just joking?
At first glance, I would say that you're a runway model, but you claimed to be a space traveler? You look nothing like the part.
What is it exactly that you do in space, Meia? Leading a space colony? A test pilot for experimental spaceships?
You're one angry woman, aren't you, Revy? You really needed this game for relaxation, I would say. I hope you enjoy this game.
Well, someone here needed a relaxing game of strip poker more than anyone else. Playing a casual game is always the best way of cooling your head.
Come to think of it, your appearance reminds me of a young trainer I battled once. You could almost pass off as her older sister.
The last time I met someone with that outfit scheme was a young trainer I battled in my villa years ago. You're the perfect age to be mistaken for her older sister.
