Just one look at you tells me that you're an athletic type, Rainbow Dash. Even in this game, you just can't stop doing calisthenics.
I'm quite good at determining other people's personalities just by looking at them, and I could immediately tell that you love exercise. Not that you made it difficult to figure out.
Do you happen to know martial arts, Rainbow Dash?
Would I be incorrect if I guessed that you train in the martial arts, Rainbow Dash?
What happens now? I don't suppose this Shiny Butterfree can strip anything unless... it molts its entire exoskeleton...
What's the protocol for when a participant has nothing to strip to begin with? Does having this Butterfree switch to it's Mega Forme count?
What a small girl you are, Chihiro. You almost remind me of Shauntal, although she's more of a creative type than an intelligent type like you.
Small, shy, demure, and very cerebral. You almost remind me of Shauntal, Chihiro. The only difference between you two is the color scheme, and the fact that she's a writer instead.
I've been wondering, Chihiro, if you can create a better version of the Pokédex. I mean, there's nothing wrong with the current versions, but there's room for improvement.
Do you happen to be familiar with the inner workings of the Pokédex, Chihiro. I've heard that they've been looking for programmers who could help create an upgraded version.
(Chihiro is panicking. I should comfort her.) It's alright, Chihiro, you have nothing to fear. We're not going to judge you even if you are naked in front of us.
(The fear in Chihiro's eyes... I must calm her down.) You can do it, Chihiro. You have nothing to worry about, my dear. This will be everybody's little secret.
You're finally back, Chihiro. I was worried that we'll never see you again. I'm not forcing you, but it would be great if you can continue the game.
Good job, Chihiro. You might have ran away, but I bet it took all of your courage to return here. Your bravery has to be commended.
Oh, you came back, Chihiro. I was worried that we would have to play the rest of the game with Alter Ego. Anyhow, you can finally resume the game.
What an uncanny resemblance... It's surprising to meet another person who has intense eyes like that Pokémon Trainer. I can see a lot of hidden power in that small frame.
Well, I had initially written you off due to your appearance, Megumin, but I can feel a strong aura coming from your eyes. You are not someone to be underestimated.
I must say, I've never seen someone extract so much power using a pure fire-type specialization. Not even Sinnoh's fire-type specialist had much use for fire-types.
It's not everyday I see someone look so formidable with only fire powers at their disposal. Powerful fire-specialist are quite rare, especially at Sinnoh.
Surely, someone with such an immense power would have uses for said power, Megumin. I'm curious to know what you use your fire magic for.
I wonder what you use your explosion magic for, Megumin. You can't be that powerful and not use it, right? That would be a waste of your abilities.
You wouldn't happen to be selling some antiques, Anna? Any artifact really, as long as it's old.
I've been wondering if you're involved in the antiquities trade, Anna. With such a large inventory of items, you might have one or two artifacts lying around.
Do you have some artifacts available for sale, Anna? Be it a small trinket, or an enormous relic; a insignificant bauble, or a historically-significant object.
Have you traveled across nations, Anna? I have a couple of questions for you, related to my study about trade across different cultures.
Surely, a traveling merchant such as yourself would have been to multiple regions, Anna. I just have something to ask to you, as part of my socioeconomic research.
I've been studying a lot lately about the cultural influence of trading merchants across nations, and I would like to ask you some questions. If you had traveled internationally, that is,
Since you're already here, why exactly did you become a pirate, Meia? Was it the promise of vast riches across the galaxy?
I'm just curious what possessed you to become a pirate in the first place, Meia. Was it the thrill of going on intergalactic adventures that hooked you in?
From what little I've known from historical pirates, most of them came from oppressed groups, and joined a life of piracy in search of freedom. Are you the same case, Meia?
So what is it exactly that you do, Revy? Aside from hanging out on streets and threatening people.
Surely, even someone like you have a job of some sort. I can't quite figure out what it could be, given your violent and unlikeable demeanor.
Hmm, are you a Hex Maniac, Tomoko? Your appearance and mannerisms suggest so, but that's not their outfit you're wearing.
It's not in the nature of a Hex Maniac to wear an outfit aside from their usual robes, so I'm beginning to doubt if you are one of them, Tomoko.
Normally, a Hex Maniac would be wearing their class's robes, and that's not quite it, despite the similarity in appearances. You do have their distinct idiosyncrasies...
You did mention a planet full of men earlier, didn't you? Have you tried living there instead, Meia? It might be better than wandering through space.
If you no longer feel welcome on your home planet, then perhaps moving to the men's planet would be the correct decision, Meia. I don't think it can be worse than cruising aimlessly in space.
Have you ever considered moving permanently onto the male planet, Meia? It won't be as claustrophobic as being in a spaceship all the time.
My, so much energy in such a small frame. Reminds me of Maylene somehow, although your voice is much more higher-pitched, and you look even younger.
The last time I've met a small girl with that much energy is Maylene back in Sinnoh. But you're even smaller than her, and you're voice is more nasally as well.
Your speech pattern is most unusual, Starfire. Would I be correct in saying that you're not a native speaker?
Your way of speaking is very reminiscent of someone speaking a non-native language. Is my observation correct, Starfire?
I've heard that you're a famous singer. That must be quite the busy schedule that you have, having to travel extensively around the world.
I imagine that the travel schedule of a famous singer such as yourself must be very extensive. Having to maximize what little free time you have can be quite challenging, I would imagine.
I must say, your outfit has quite the professional feel to it, and combined with your apparent lack of sleep... Why, you must be an academic, Tomoko!
Despite your disheveled and sleep-deprived appearance, you do have an aura of professionalism emanating from you, Tomoko... You could only be an academic! Your outfit even fits the style of one.
That's quite an impressive costume you're wearing, Arash. It almost looks like a real suit of armor. The detailing on it is just exquisite.
That must have been quite an expensive costume you're wearing, Arash. The attention to detail of it points to an advanced level of craftsmanship.
Oh my, what an unbelievably large syringe. I don't think even the most high-class of Pokémon Centers have a syringe of that size.
Look at the size of that syringe! I bet even the Pokémon Centers would be hard-pressed to find a syringe of that size.
Oh, I never thought I'd meet someone dressed as a 6th century crown prince. I always felt that period to be one of the most under-appreciated.
A 6th century nobleman costume... It's rare for me to meet someone who's also interested in that era. It's criminal how much that period is ignored.
Was your kingdom tolerant of homosexual relationships, Miko? Based on your relationship with your wife, I'm inclined to guess yes.

I've learned that homosexual relationships were prevalent in your time period, but not unanimously accepted among all cultures at the time. I was wondering what your kingdom's stance on the issue was, Miko.
What an intriguing outfit. It reminds me of the Galarian and Kalosian outfits worn by common people from the days of old. It's surprising seeing one in the present day.
Your attire has certainly caught my attention, Kazuma. I've seen those before, but in museums, being the common folk's attire centuries ago in regions like Galar and Kalos.
You're from an all-female planet, correct? Is that the reason why you're quite desperate to be with a man?... The thrill of something new...
If it's true that you're from a planet with no men... Is that where your obsession with men originate from? You view men as being exotic, and want one for yourself...?
I heard you mention that you were training to be a Pokémon doctor, Maki. Let me guess: your Pokémon are psychic-type and bug-types. Is my assumption correct?
It's not often I meet Pokémon doctoral student, Maki. I do appreciate the Full Restores doctors give me when I defeat them in battle. I do wonder if you'll do the same for this game...
Ah, a Pokémon doctor! Or rather, a trainee. Either way, my Pokémon are currently in well-condition, but I do appreciate it if you can lend me a couple of Max Revives, as a gift perhaps?
Oh, I remember you! You're that trainer that I fought in the Alola Battle Tree! Long time no see, Moon!
You look familiar... Wait, I battled you in Alola, didn't I?... My memory isn't deceiving me, you're the same Moon. Nice to meet you! I didn't expect to come across you in a place like this.
Wait, are you the same Moon I encountered in Alola?... You are! I haven't seen you since our battle, and you're quite a long way from home, I must say.
Last I heard, you competed to be the inaugural Alola League Champion, Moon. How did your venture go?
According to the grapevine, you were training to compete for the newly created Alola League, Moon. Did you happen to succeed?
Before I left Alola, someone told me that you had signed up for the Alola League, Moon. Since you proved to be a strong trainer, I'm wondering if you won.
Hold on just a minute! I saw you... emerge from a portal! You don't originate from the Distortion World, do you?
Did my eyes deceive me, or did you hop out of a portal from nowhere?! It's not the Distortion World on the other end of that portal, was it?
My, what a jarringly violet color palette! You must be a ghost-type trainer, Neptune. Why do ghost-types always wear purple?
I know a ghost-type trainer when I see one. It's not difficult, when almost all ghost-type trainers have a fashion sense dominated by violet.
Ah! I know that outfit. That's a traditional Unovan outfit, specifically from --
I think I've seen a similar outfit to yours in Unova before... Yes, I remember that from --
Aimee, do me a favor and... What are you shooting vertically for?! There's only one way those bullets would fall!
Now, let's put the gun down... What are you doing?! Those bullets can't stay in the air forever!
That's even worse! How do you even know where that thing is pointed at?!
Are you deliberately trying to make your stunts more reckless than the last?!
I've never seen such complete disregard for public safety!
Shooting upwards again? At least you're the only one who might get hit if you misaim...
... This again? I hope you've got the measure of this the second time around...
You're not actually planning to shoot your underwear, are you? It's barely more than a string!
This is an impossible task you're planning... Surely, hitting a target that small is not a realistic expectation, even for you...
I've got a random question for you, ~supernova~: If you were to recreate the universe in your own image, how would you go about doing it?
Are you knowledgeable about the universe's creation, ~supernova~? What would you say is your preferred method of creating your own universe?
When you say that you're a goddess, Neptune, do you mean that you're worshiped by an imperial cult? I thought that practice had largely died out by this point in history.
A monarch deified by an imperial cult... Does that describes your situation accurately, Neptune? And here I thought that practice had largely died out centuries ago...

I can tell immediately from your accent that you're Kalosian, Ladybug. Say, is that a ceremonial outfit you're currently wearing? I'm afraid I'm not that familiar with Kalosian culture compared with the other regions.

Hmm, is that the Kalosian accent I hear from your voice, Ladybug? I also can't recognize your outfit, be it due to its peculiarity of it or my unfamiliarity with most of the culture from the Kalos region.

I can't say that I expected to meet a native of Kalos in this setting, Ladybug. You're a long way away from home, aren't you? Although, I'm more intrigued by your unusual outfit. It's unlike anything I've ever seen!
Huh? Are you... one of those Kalosian exotic performers I keep hearing about? What is going on here...?
Are you... an exotic performer from Kalos? You sure do have the accent of a Kalosian... I just... didn't expect to run across one in here...
Is that... a military uniform... composed of a leotard?... I'm guessing you must be a member of the navy. That's the only logical explanation I could come up with.
Your leotard made me think that you were wearing a swimsuit... but you seem to be wearing adornments more fitting for a military uniform. That doesn't happen to be the uniform of the navy, does it?
Your outfit is strangely... familiar for some reason... I think I might have seen some foreign tourists wearing similar clothing to yours... Have you been to Sinnoh before, Chun-Li?
I'm getting a strange feeling about your outfit, Chun-Li... As if I've seen it before... Perhaps I might have seen it worn by tourists before...? Anyway, have you visited Sinnoh in the past?
Oh my! What big ears you have, Erufuda! Is that a physical deformity caused by excessive cholesterol intake?
Those ears! Why do they look like that? Are those the physical manifestation of an unhealthy diet?
You called yourself a "Pegasus Knight", correct? What exactly is "Pegasus"? Is it the name of your founder, or does the name of your order have a deeper etymology?
I've heard you refer to yourself as a "Pegasus Knight", Florina, but I was curious where your order derived its name from? What exactly does "Pegasus" refer to?
You're one of those "social recluse" I keep hearing about, Futaba? I've always been intrigued as to why someone would voluntary withdraw themselves from society.
Aren't you one of those... what was it called... a "shut-in", Futaba? I'm interested in knowing why you chose to keep yourself cooped up indoors when the outside world is full of wonders to explore.

I keep hearing about people who suffer from "Acute Social Withdrawal", but I didn't get to meet one personally until now... Are there any practical reason you've completely withdrawn yourself from society, Futaba?
Ah, I know a noblewoman when I see one, Miss Haru. Despite your rather modest outfit, your aura shines right through it.
Other people might not have picked this up, but I can tell that you're of a upper-class upbringing, Miss Haru. It will take more than a sweater to hide that fact.

It takes more than just flashy upbringing to differentiate a noble person and a commoner, and I can easily tell you're the former, Miss Haru. Although, I don't blame you for attempting to mask it in this setting,
I seem to recall you mentioning earlier that you're a student of parapsychology, Ini... I have a lot of questions regarding psychics that I hope you would be able to answer, if you don't mind.

Parapsychology, from what I can recall, is the study of psychic powers, correct? You might be only a student of this field, but I'm intrigued if you would be willing to answer some questions regarding psychic powers.

Would you be willing to answer some of my queries regarding psychic powers, Ini? You said earlier that you're a student of the field that investigates these phenomena, and I feel that you can clear the air for me.

You referred to yourself as an AI earlier, Kizuna... I assume you meant Artificial Intelligence... Are you a realistic looking cyborg? You seem very human, aside from making comments to nobody in particular, and the unusual glow.

Are you really an Artificial Intelligence, Kizuna, or were you just bluffing? Either way, you're very human in terms of appearance and action. Your only flaws is that you're talking to an unseen listener, and you're glowing.

You're supposed to be an Artificial Intelligence, Kizuna? If that's the case, then you're certainly leaps ahead of the other robots I've seen. Although, you're not without flaws, mostly concerning your speech output, and bioluminescence.

Ah, a priestess, and one who is very eager in proselytizing as well! Hearing about your religion's creation story would be of paramount importance to my research, and I urge you to be as detailed as you can.

You might not know it, but you're exactly the type of person I'm seeking for! If there's anyone who would be knowledgeable about a religion's creation story, it would be a devout priestess! Please, do tell all the details.

After historians, I would expect a member of the clergy to be the most reliable source when it comes to the creation story of a religion. I'm currently embroiled in a study of creation stories, and I would very much appreciate it if you share yours.
I'm getting a weird feeling from you, Mae... As if you're just a Meowth that got transplanted into a human body... Perhaps, it's because you have similar idiosyncrasies...
Not to be rude or anything, Mae... but I'm getting a peculiar feeling... as if you're just a Meowth disguised as a human... I suppose it's because your mannerisms remind me of a Meowth...

Are you the housekeeper of this establishment, Nugi-chan? I know better than to underestimate anyone in a maid outfit. I've battled my fair share of maids, and they're usually more ferocious than they let on.

Ah, an innocent-looking maid, aren't you, Nugi-chan? I've met plenty of maids that are as demure as you are during my battles, and let me tell you, there's always more than meets the eye when battling them.

I bet everyone in here thinks that you're just an unassuming, little maid, but I know better than to judge someone by their looks. If my battles against them has taught me anything, it's that maids can go from 0 to 100 in the blink of an eye.
Pardon me if this might sound a bit rude, but what exactly are you, Orendi? You somewhat look like a Cofagrigus that has gained a human form.
Are you a human, or a Cofagrigus in human form?! I can tell which is the correct case for you, Orendi?
Ah, a Kalosian! I'm not too familiar with your culture, so your outfit is a bit... confusing for me. Anyway, I was curious what "PA-15" stood for, Florence.
Two things caught my attention immediately, Florence. Firstly, that outfit is quite unlike anything I've seen. Secondly, I was wondering if "PA-15" has any significance.
I'm not sure if I should ask the meaning of "PA-15", or ask the design logic of your outfit... Oh, it seems I was thinking out loud again! Anyway, I'm genuinely curious about those two,
I've got a bit of a personal question for you, ~supernova~. If you were given the chance of moving to a world completely devoid of emotions and hope, would you take the opportunity?
This might be a random thing to ask, but if you had to choose between this universe, and another universe where emotions don't exist, which one would you choose?
A masked man wielding a large sword... How terribly suspicious... (I should get Garchomp ready just in case.)
Well, that's as suspicious of a sight as we're going to get in a setting like this... (Garchomp should be more than enough to take care of this suspicious man.)
What a marvelous outfit, Palutena! You look a lot like those ancient goddess sculptures from two millennia ago. You even had the golden leaf headpiece to go along with it.
My, you certainly stand out like a goddess, Palutena. Specifically, the goddesses of a certain pantheon that was predominant more than two thousand years ago. Nice attention to detail, I must say.
I'm not sure if you intended it or not, but your outfit look very similar to those of goddesses that were worshiped dozens of centuries ago. You have the stature to compliment the outfit as well.
I cannot believe the vulgarity and perverseness that has come out of your mouth so far, Panty! There is no doubt in my mind that you're nowhere near to being an angel!
In the couple of minutes that we've been playing this game, you've said things that I've never heard before, and don't want to hear again, Panty. A real angel would never say any of those things.
I can immediately tell you're a boxer, Ribbon Girl. Say, you wouldn't happen to be a fighting-type trainer, would you?
You're a boxer, Ribbon Girl, but that wasn't difficult to guess given the gloves you're wearing... Do you happen to be a fighting-type trainer as well?
I'm confused over your background, Saki... Are you an idol, a biker, or a zombie? You seemed to insinuate that you were all three...
Based on your statement earlier... you're an idol, or a biker, or a zombie... I'm confused since you backtracked on what you said...

I remember reading about genies before... According to the manuscript I read, genies are spirits that have the same origins as humans, but got changed somehow by the surroundings. Was that accurate, Shantae?

I do remember a handful of manuscripts which describe genies. If my memory is correct, genies are identical in every way to humans, even their origins, aside from the fact that genies are powerful spirits. Was my memory accurate, Shantae?
Just from the looks of your uniform, it's evident that you belong to an upper-class family, Sola. Can you discuss what exactly is the source of your family's fortune?
You must be from a well-off family, if the appearance of your school uniform is anything to go by, Sola. What is it that your parents do?
A violent spirit?! Don't panic, ~player~, this ghost is no match for my Spiritomb. This should be a fairly quick affair.
Watch out, ~player~! This malevolent spirit is carrying a sharp knife! I've fought off this type of spirit before, and my Spiritomb will do quick work of this.
Hold on, what's this?! Stay back, ~player~! This specter looks particularly violent. Fortunately, my Spiritomb knows how to handle a situation like this.
My, I can immediately tell that you're from the Galar region just from your accent alone, Syrenne. I'd even wager that you're from Motostoke City, based on the intonation.

What an awfully distinctive accent! If I'm going to guess your place of origin, I'm betting it's Motostoke City, in the Galar Region. The local accent is just a tad bit different from the other regional Galarian accents.
Huh, what a... provocative outfit... Very reminiscent of those of... exotic dancers from... previous millennia... Wait, you're not an actual exotic dancer, are you? You just look like one...?
Funny enough, you're outfit reminds me a lot of a painting of exotic dancers from the Fertile Crescent... Just a coincidence, isn't it?... You're not an exotic dancer, are you?
I'm not the type of person that comments on clothes regularly, but I must say that your dress has very regal feel to it, Weiss. It makes you look like a princess.
It's not often that I comment on clothes the first time I met a person, but I fell it would be remiss if I didn't compliment your attire, Weiss. It radiates an upper-class royalty feel.

Not to be shallow or anything, but I felt that the design of your dress is worth complimenting, Weiss. It gives off a sense prestige and wealth, which you would usually only see with members of the upper class and royalty.
... Interesting... My Pokémon in their Poké Balls are radiating a happy feeling. Are you the reason? What are you, Zizou?
... That's strange... I can feel some form of energy radiating from your direction, Zizou... And my Pokémon are responding positively to it. How could that be?
Hold on just a minute... Named after a celestial object... Talks about being the god of another world... Weird hair color... You're a member of Team Galactic, aren't you?!

... I've met a group of people who are very similar to you, Neptune: Bearing the name of a heavenly body, claims to rule another world as a god, unusual choice of hair dye... You must be a Team Galactic grunt!
You mentioned a "social interaction practice" earlier, Bernadetta. Is that something people in your culture do as part of their studies?
Is a "social interaction practice" something people of your age are expected to do where you're from, Bernadetta?

What an... intriguing choice of knife, Chara. Creepy knives aside, it looks like you have a lot of interesting stories to tell, about where you're from. Don't ask how I knew, I just had a gut feeling.
Looking past that knife with a rather concerning color, my intuition tells me that you come from an interesting place, Chara. I have a feeling that you have some intriguing tales from your homeplace.
What a remarkable outfit, Pyrrha! It reminds me a lot of the battle armor worn by the Ancient Western Empire... Hold on a minute, what is your surname, Pyrrha?
I must say, being a historian, I'm appreciating the fact that your outfit was inspired by the Ancient Western Empire, Pyrrha... Wait, Pyrrha... What did you say your surname was?
Wait, I just realized something: Your name is Pyrrha... and your outfit takes heavy influence from the Ancient Western Empire... Can you reveal what your family name is?
Would you happen to be a biker, Jim? I've heard bikers are prevalent in most regions of the world, but Sinnoh oddly doesn't have any...
I've never seen a biker before, but I would envision that they would have roughly the same attire as you, Jim, assuming you're not one of them.
Did you mention that you were part of a Fairy Tale guild, Lucy? I remember when I used to read fairy tales all the time when I was a child. It served as my first insight to cultures of the past.
You're a member of a Fairy Tale guild, Lucy? I wish Celestic town had a Fairy Tale Guild when I was a child. I probably would have attended that guild everyday.

Hey, I remember wearing an outfit like that before! It was when we were going to explore a pyramid in the middle of the Great Rainforest. I must say, having to hack through the brush and mire wasn't the most pleasant of experiences.

Planning to explore a forest in the immediate future, Jason? The last time I wore an outfit like that, it was to excavate an ancient city in the middle of the forest at the Rich Coast... That's why I don't excavate in the forests anymore.
I don't know what you're planning with that rocket launcher, but I won't hesitate to bring out my entire Pokémon team if you do anything violent with it.

A rocket launcher?! I don't know how you got that thing past security, but if you have violent intentions, the line ends here! I have my entire Pokémon team at my disposal, and they're not afraid of that thing!
What's going on here?! Doesn't matter, what matters is that I put a stop to this! Good thing I have all my Pokémon with me right now!
You mentioned earlier that you were an archmage, Yunyun. Does that mean that your psychic powers are particularly strong?
What exactly does being an archmage entail, Yunyun? Is it an indication that you've achieved a high level of mastery of your psychic powers?
How exactly does one like yourself become an archmage, Yunyun? Does a proficiency in controlling your psychic powers grant you the title of being an archmage?

I was thinking that I might have brought one too many accessories to this game, but you brought a cardboard box as your accessory! At least, I think that's what your plan with the box is, Myriam. It's meant as an extra layer, right?
A cardboard box? Is this a last-ditch attempt at increasing your layer count, Myriam? It looks a bit comical, but I suppose it serves its purpose.

I just have to... stare at amazement at how far out of the box some people will think when faced with a problem. It seems in your case, it was hiding inside the box that was your solution to increase your layer count, Myriam.
Your outfit is glorious, Laevatein! There's no other words that can adequately describe it! Is it meant to be evocative of a Toucannon?
That's an impressive outfit you're donning, Laevatein. It's very evident that a lot of time and effort went to its creation. Is it inspired by Toucannon?
It's pretty evident that you're the captain of a ship. Captain Kokichi, do you happen to know the captain of the S.S. Spiral?
I might not meet sailors often, but I can recognize one when I see one. Anyway, would you happen to be familiar with the captain of the S.S. Spiral, Captain Kokichi?
Are you a lone wanderer of sorts, Deimos? You seem to be rather beaten by your travels. Where are you from?
It seems I'm not the only one here that traveled a long way just to get here. Although, you look more like a lone wanderer than I am. From where did you travel from, Deimos?

I've noticed that you seem to be unfamiliar with the local customs, Twilight. I can say that I'm experiencing the same thing, since I arrived in this place just an hour ago. What region are you from anyway?

I'm relieved that I'm not the only non-local in this place, Twilight. Just like you, I'm also unfamiliar with the culture in this region. I arrived just over an hour ago through a flight from Sinnoh. How long have you been here, and where are you originally from?

You're quite an... excitable person, Pinkie. I don't think I was ever that energetic even when I was still a child. Do you happen to be the person in charge of bringing excitement to this game, or are you always like this?

I don't think I've ever seen anyone jump around as much as you do, Pinkie. It doesn't look like you're even breaking a sweat either. Are you being paid to bring energy here, or is this just something you normally do?

Ah, you're obviously a fashionista, Rarity. Do you happen to be well-connected in the fashion industry? I was just wondering if you happen to know the tailor that crafts the sygna suits. They seem to be the fashion rage these days.

I must say, you've got a great fashion sense, Rarity. I'm assuming you've got a lot of connections in the fashion world, so I wonder if you happen to have any info about the tailor of the sygna suits. Everybody seems to be keen on getting in contact with him.
Would you mind detailing every atrocity that ~player~ committed in your world, Chara?
Do you have any recollections of all the horrible things ~player~ did in your world, Chara?
Hmm... You mentioned earlier that you're from Muspell, Laevatein... I don't think your outfit is endemic to any of the regions I've personally visited. Where exactly is Muspell?

I seem to remember you mentioning earlier that you're a native of a region called Muspell, Laevatein. You don't quite look like a native of any of the regions I know of. Can you point out where Muspell is?
You seem to be rather interconnected with this "Hank" person, but who is he? And why are you acquainted with him?
You must be very close to this "Hank" if you're willingly putting yourself into this much trouble for his sake. Who is he anyway?
It's been often said that ghosts are the spirits of people who died with unfinished business. So, I wonder what yours was, Spooky.
There's no reason for a spirit to manifest itself as a ghost, unless it is still not ready to leave. What kind of event is preventing you from leaving the mortal realm, Spooky?
A patron of the arts, I see. What kind of arts are your favorite, Yusuke? I would say mine are the realist paintings, as it gives everybody a good glimpse of daily life.
Meeting an art enthusiast in a place like this is a bit of a welcome surprise, I must say. Are you also a fan of the Realism artistic movement, or do you consider something else as your favorite?
It must have been quite the struggle leading a revolution like that, Jim. How are things looking up now?
A revolution of that scale results in massive reforms that can take years to take hold. Have situations improved due to your revolution?
So, Yusuke, what kind of themes do you usually utilize in your paintings? I know of another artist whose art gallery are mostly themed around Bug Pokémon.
Every artist, from what I've learned, have a central theme that are visible in their body of work. What would you say is your central theme in your artworks, Yusuke?
You know, all this talk of an all-female planet reminds me of an epic, where an island inhabited solely by women was discovered by a ship crewed mostly by men...

Funny enough, this wouldn't be the first time I would have heard of an all-female society. Not a planet, but an island with no men in it, which just happened to be visited by a nearly all-male ship...
Speaking of the Ancient Western Empire, you wouldn't happen to own a spear or javelin, would you? I just remembered a statue that resembles you, and that's the only thing missing.
There's still something missing from your outfit... Oh, I know! A javelin! Add that, and you're now a foot soldier for the Ancient Western Empire! Or at least, you would look like one.
One look at you tells me a lot about you, and I can confidently say that you're an explorer of some sort. Particularly, the type to explore rainforests and such. Is my assessment correct?
It might be a little obvious of me to say, but you're outfit really does match the rainforest explorer archetype. Surely, that must be the only explanation why you were carrying a machete.
If you didn't go to school, I suppose you spent your childhood filling up your Pokédex like most enterprising children do, Jason.

I don't know if it also applies here, but in my experience, children either go to school, or they begin exploring all over their region in order to get entries for their Pokédex. I would assume you're part of the latter.
Now that your world has been rid of these monsters, what are your plans, Chara? Do you plan to go back to your world?
With all those monsters exterminated, I suppose you can now reside in peace in your world, Chara. Do you have plans to do so?
You look familiar... for whatever reason... Have we met before, Bulma? A Pokémon tournament sponsor perhaps?
Do you happened to have sponsored a Pokémon tournament before, Bulma? I think that's how we've met before...
Huh, what are you?... Are you an illusion created by a Gastly? I've heard Gastly can be quite mischievous when around unfamiliar people...
Are you supposed to be an illusion? The work of a Gastly perhaps? I've read folk stories about this, but never actually witnessed one before.
That outfit... Are you from Eastern Kalos or the surrounding area, Penny? I think I recognize that attire!
I think I've seen that outfit before, Penny... You originate from around Eastern Kalos, correct?
Ah, an adventurer. I remember when I used to go to adventures when I was a kid. Filling up my Pokédex was hard work, but very fulfilling.
So do you explore caves and such, ~name~? I used to explore those for fun when I was a kid, but now I do it as part of my archaeological studies.
I suddenly recall that I used to go on trips to other regions just to fill up my Pokédex. Ah, to be a kid again!
Ah, another Sinnoh native! I didn't expect to meet you here, ~name~. And I thought I was far away from home.
It's always nice to think of home when you're so far away, and you're helping in that regard, ~name~. I never would have thought I'd ran into another Sinnohlian here.
Nice to meet you, ~name~. Are you familiar with Undella Town? I have a villa there that I hang out in during the summer months. I plan to return there for the upcoming summer. Care to visit?
Long time no see, ~name~. You know me, don't you? Anyhow, I'm planning to stay at my summer villa at Undella Town this upcoming summer, and every trainer in Unova is invited to hang out.
You're from Alola, ~name~? I've been to Alola once, to participate in the Battle Tree. Ended up taking a rather lengthy vacation there. I just loved the tropical weather.
Did you really flew all the way from Alola just to play here, ~name~? I remember flying non-stop from Sinnoh to Alola way back, and the flight felt like an eternity.
How has Alola been doing recently, ~name~? Last I've heard, it was being plagued by creatures known as "Ultra Beasts", but the matter had been resolved.
What a messy hair that is, ~name~! You'd look better if you fix it up, you know. Hair hygiene is always a top priority.
Your hair is quite ruffled, ~name~. Do find some time to fix it up when you can.
Is that a... half-man, half-Pokémon hybrid?!
~Name~?! You... that look... are you half-Pokémon?!
Hold on, you're not quite human. Just what are you, ~name~?... Or is that just an outfit?
Well, what an interesting outfit... Or is it an outfit at all...?
That's quite the unusual complexion you have, ~name~. I don't think I've seen anyone with that skin color before.
I must say, you're skin color is of a shade I've never seen on humans before. Feels very surreal looking at it.
Are my eyes deceiving me, or is that the most unnatural looking color I've seen on a human?
Did you know that there are some cultures in the island chains surrounding Alola that have been practicing tattoo markings since before recorded history?
Those ink markings on your skin are certainly very impressive, ~name~. I presume you had them done using modern methods? Traditional methods can be quite a painful process.
I haven't seen a ink marking like that outside of this game since my last visit at Alola. The traditional way of making skin markings is quite an intricate and time-consuming process.
Oh, is that a tail plug you're wearing, ~name~? I remember seeing one of those in the online store once, heh...
I remember receiving a tail plug as an anonymous gift once. I still haven't tried putting it on.
I can't really tell if you're a man and a woman... We'll just have to wait for you to get naked to find out.
You have the facial and physical features of both man and woman. It would be interesting to find out your true gender, because I can't figure it out for myself yet.
A gun... I can't say I've seen guns that often, even in museums. Aside from the national regulation on guns, people usually just use Pokémon for self-defense.
Be careful where you point that gun, ~name~. If you point it at someone one too many times, you might get banned like that safari ranger.
You might be a tad overdressed for a game like this, ~name~, even if you intended to increase your layer count. No matter, there's no guaranteed victory in a game like this.
Well, well, well. I can see you took quite an interesting path with your attire choice. We'll have to wait and see if it pays off.
Between the two of us, we are making this place look more like a formal gathering than a strip poker game.
You do realize that the goal of this game is to not end up naked, right? You're not really helping your chance of winning by picking that outfit.
Well, that's quite an interesting choice of clothes for this setting... You must be very confident to put yourself in a hefty handicap like that.
I suppose you have a well-thought plan for this, ~name~... I don't see the point of wearing such skimpy outfit to a strip poker game.
I do hope you're of the proper age, ~name~. This could potentially lead to a scandal that would end my career.
I do trust that this establishment would do an age check on its players. Still, I can't get the thought out of my mind...
You don't look that much older than some of the trainers that have battled me. Some them are just kids...
You... you don't have the personality of someone that I'd expect to play a game like this.
You're shy, yet you chose to play a strip poker game... Trying to get out of your comfort zone, I would presume. This is quite an extreme way of doing it, though.
You don't look like the type to go willingly to a game like this. I do know a couple of people who are quite demure in public, but very wild in private.
You were aware that this was a strip poker game, right? Why would you even join this if you're afraid of being naked?
You do know the consequences of losing at strip poker, right? I'm just checking that you know what you're getting yourself into, ~name~.
I sense that you're not quite comfortable at the possibility of you having to strip naked in front of us, ~name~...
I get the feeling that you'd faint if you end up going naked in front of everyone here...
You're clearly not fazed by the possibility of going nude in front of strangers, ~name~. I always say that this game is half-mental, so that attitude will suit you well.
No hint of fear in body language at all, ~name~. you're exactly the type of opponent I came to expect in a game like this.
I'd say that the most difficult part of strip poker is keeping a cool head, while the possibility of losing is looming over your head. I can see that's not going to be an issue for you, ~name~.
Something about the way you act is... off...
You give me all the wrong vibes, ~name~... I'm keeping a close watch on you.
One look at you tells me many things about you. You're obviously intelligent and cunning. I wouldn't be surprised if you have a trick up your sleeve, ~name~.
You know the saying that intelligent people can recognize other intelligent people? I can only speculate at your strategy for this game. Surely someone of your intellect formulated a plan.
I can tell just by the way you coordinate yourself that you have a strategy for this game. Well then, let's see how your strategy fare against mine, ~name~.
You seem to be quite obsessed with ~player~, ~name~. I dare say to an unhealthy degree... (Strip poker might not be the only competition in this table if this keeps up.)
You can't seem to take your attention away from ~player~, ~name~. You're not even trying to be subtle with it, either. (I wish I was that confident around ~player~.)
With the way you talk up ~player~, I would suppose you would react rather negatively to anyone who dare grab his attention, ~name~. (How am I supposed to approach ~player~ now?)
I've noticed that you've been enjoying this game quite a lot, ~name~. Even before this game began, you had that excited look in your eyes.
I can already tell that you've been enjoying this game so far, ~name~. We are here to have fun after all, but you seem to be enjoying it the most.
First defeat aside, it looks like this game has lived up to your expectations so far, ~name~. Possibly even surpassed it.
... Interesting... I can sense my Pokémon in their Pokéballs are radiating a happy feeling. Are you the reason? What are you, ~name~?
... That's quite odd... I can feel some sort of power radiating from you, ~name~. Not at all different from the power I felt while facing Giratina... Just what exactly are you?
I sense a regal presence emanating from you, ~name~... The type of presence that warrants respect... As if you're of a higher status than everybody else...
Oh, I can easily recognize that accent of yours, ~name~! You're from the Unova region, no doubt about it. I stay there every summer, so I'm already used to hearing that accent.
Are you from Unova, ~name~? Your accent kind of sounds like it came from the Unova region.
It's so nice to meet a native of Unova! I don't think I've met you in my summer vacations at Unova yet, ~name~.
I can't quite place that accent of yours, ~name~... I'm tempted to say it's a Kalosian accent, but my only exposure to it is on TV.
I like your accent, ~name~. It somewhat reminds me of the Kalosian accent I hear from the movies. I do know that movies tend to get accents wrong, and I haven't heard a Kalosian talk in person.
Do you happen to be from Kalos, ~name~? I should really get around to traveling there soon. It's probably the only region I haven't visited in the past couple of years.
Is that the Galarian accent I'm hearing from you, ~name~? It's like the Unovan accent, but more upper-class sounding.
Did you know that Sinnoh didn't have a flight route to Galar up until recently, ~name~?... You are from Galar, right? That's what I inferred from your accent.
Your Galarian accent reminds me of that time everybody boycotted a Galar-based video game for some reason... I think it was something about having fewer available Pokémon...
Ah, a native of The Crown Tundra... This is the first time I've met one of you outside of The Crown Tundra. Traveling isn't exactly huge in your culture, ~name~.
That accent could only have come from The Crown Tundra. I keep hearing that it has a similar climate to Sinnoh during the winter months. I might visit there in the near future for a dig.
I get the feeling that you're more knowledgeable about current electronic gadgets than I do, ~name~. I haven't exactly been keeping up with the latest technological trends.
Some people say that I'm quite old-school in terms of technology. I just find it hard to keep track of every new gadget in the market. Technology seems to be developing faster than ever.
We seem to have a very similar taste in dark-colored clothing, ~name~.
We have a outfit theme going between the two of us, ~name~.
Sunglasses are a little redundant in a locale like this, don't you think?
Well, it's not like you need sunglasses in this time and place, so why did you even bring one...?
Errg come on, ~not_guzma~! Don't let Guzma win!
That's it, ~not_guzma~! We can't let Guzma win under any conditions!
What a horrible turn of luck for you, ~name~! Your hand wouldn't be a loser 99 times out of a 100, .
You would normally assume that your hand would have been safe from a loss, ~name~, but that's just the nature of card games in a nutshell.
My, aren't you rather straightforward, Streaming-chan! If truth be told, I was just hoping to spice things up tonight!
My, aren't you rather straightforward, Streaming-chan! If truth be told, I was just hoping to spice things up tonight! A little change of pace's never killed anyone.
My, aren't you rather straightforward, Streaming-chan! If truth be told, I was hoping to see some cute guys is all.
My, aren't you rather straightforward, Streaming-chan! If truth be told, I was hoping to see some cute guys show me something nice.
My, aren't you rather straightforward, Streaming-chan! If truth be told, I was hoping to see some cute guys tonight, buuuuut...
My, aren't you rather straightforward, Streaming-chan! If truth be told, I was hoping to see some guys tonight...
And the victor is: Cynthia! For a second there, I thought I lost.
That's three losses in a row, ~name~; I'll have you know, if this was all just a stunt to masturbate in front of me, I am not impressed!
That's three losses in a row, ~name~; I'll have you know, if this was all just an excuse to masturbate in front of me, I am not impressed!
Are you trying to lose, ~name~? I do not take kindly to perverts taking any opportunity they can to fondle themselves in front of me!
Ha, it looks like you're trying to lose, ~name~. You wouldn't be the first guy to want to expose himself in front of me.
Hmm? Three in a row? Are you trying to lose? I'll have you know, I don't appreciate you removing the challenge of this game.
Hmm? Three in a row? Are you trying to lose? I'll have you know, I was hoping you would make this at least a little challenging for me.
This would be your third straight loss, ~name~. I cannot believe this string of bad luck you're experiencing.
You've achieved a hat-trick of losses now, ~name~. Your card exchange strategy simply isn't working.
Some cultures associate the number 4 with death and consider it as unlucky. Four losses in a row falls under the same regard.
One loss is a fluke, two losses is a coincidence, three losses is a streak of bad luck... Surely, losing four in a row is an anomaly.
Losing four consecutive rounds is just really unlucky. Even when you intentionally try to lose, it wouldn't be easy to accomplish.
The odds of this losing streak occurring, it has to be nothing short of astronomical!
Is this game rigged to make ~name~ lose? There's no way this losing streak is happening naturally.
You probably should learn the mechanics of poker first before playing a game like this, ~name~. This losing streak of yours is laughable.
All of your layers gone in a string of losses! You cannot write a script like this!
I can't believe you lost all eight layers without as much as a pause in between your losses!
For you to go from having the maximum layer count to being naked within eight rounds is an impressive event by itself.
Losing with a two pair on hand is quite uncommon. You were just unlucky this round, ~name~.
Just when you thought that having two pairs would be a guaranteed safety from losing...
Losing with two pairs on your hand... If only the fifth card was more useful...
How did you lose with a royal flush?! That's not possible under normal gameplay! (Please report this bug)
The rule of three simply wasn't in your favor, ~name~...
Losing with three of a kind on your hand... Just goes to show how unpredictable one-hand poker can be.
That was a close shave. I almost lost for the first time there.
Thanks for taking the defeat for me, ~name~. I thought I was going to lose this round.
I didn't think my undefeated streak will go on for at least another round. My hand was pretty bad.
Well, what a stroke of bad luck, ~name~. I could have sworn my high card would be a losing hand.
I still had some small items to spare, but it's nice that I don't have to strip them just yet.
My extra layer of defense remains solid.
Oh, good! For a second there, I thought I might finally have to strip something substantial.
My heart almost skipped a beat when I couldn't find a pair! I'm just glad I didn't lose.
You had no idea how close I was to losing my top, ~name~.
That was your chance, ~name~. My hand was very vulnerable! Don't worry, you'll have another chance I'm sure.
Don't feel too bad, ~name~. We were both unlucky that round; you were just a tad bit unluckier than I was!
If the cards had been distributed differently, I would have lost instead of you.
Oh, I was so close to having to bare my breasts! What a stroke of luck!
A high card... I wouldn't have thought I'd be spared from embarrassment with a high card.
Well, I didn't get a pair, and neither did you in more ways than one.
I'm just glad I didn't have to bare it all just yet.
This is fantastic! Saved from the brink of defeat!
I did this without a pair. I don't know what to say...
From the brink of defeat! Now I know I can still win this game!
Another chance! I was so certain that I was going to be eliminated. I'm not going to squander this!
I hope you've realized what you've missed out on, ~name~!
I might have survived this round, but I need to do better than this if I am to win.
Errg come on, ~name~! Don't let Guzma win!
Reserved for future Neptune Interaction. Report this bug if you see this message.
Huh? T-Tharja, are you alright? What's... What are you doing? ... Th-
Did you know that someone had been spreading rumors that you're a porn movie star? I can't believe the nerve of some people!
You might be very flirtatious, but that doesn't justify people spreading the malicious rumor that you perform in porn films.
You have a family? How do they feel about your career path? There's no way of measuring the awkwardness I would feel in that situation.
You're married with kids? I didn't know they have actual mothers in porn films! What does your family have to say about your job?
... I... I did not mean that, Jessie...! I wanted to know about your emotions and thoughts during that time...
Oh... that certainly sounds nice, Jessie... but I was more curious about the emotional effect of that experience...
Is that so? Some choice words can do the trick? Can you give an example of those?
Can you give me an example of how you approach a man confidently?... I find that part rather fascinating.
When you put it like that, I suppose I've been staring at everybody. Can't let anyone cheat on this game, you know.
Regardless of whether it's considered as staring or not, I've been keeping track of everybody's layer count.
I swear, I wasn't staring at you like that, Jessie. I'm not even attracted to women.
You're misinterpreting the situation, Jessie. I came here to meet men, not other women.
It... wasn't like that... (She might be right. Is that the reason why I'm feeling tingly inside?)
I swear... it was because I was keeping track of the game... (My body is betraying me right now. This isn't what I'm feeling at all.)
All right, I suppose you got me. I must concede that this is exciting me in a way that I've never experienced before.
There's no point in denying the obvious. I wouldn't have thought something like this would turn me on so much. It feels incredible.
J-Jessie! That wasn't something I usually do!
J-Jessie!... I only did that for this game only. I swear, that's not something I would usually do.

Suppose that in your hypothetical scenario, you have captured two out of three of the creation trio, and thus have the power to destroy this universe, and build a new one in your image. That's the dream scenario for someone like you, isn't it?

Just imagine that you had captured the Pokémon that controls time and space, allowing you to shape a new universe in any way you deem fit, with the side effect that this universe would get destroyed. Isn't that what you dream of?

Well... I think the Sinnoh creation story would be a great place to start. After all, it tells the story of the world's creation, and of space and time. I could tell you the full story if you're interested.

The creation story of the Sinnoh region is very close to my heart, so I would recommend starting off with that. It's such an engrossing tale, and can retell it right here, right now if you want to here it.
I am 100% positive than we are not siblings at all... Okay, more like 95%, but what are the odds of that happening, right?
Come to think of it, there's no way we're related, right? I'm pretty sure I've heard of similar stories before, but this can't possibly be the case here.
The odds of two long-lost siblings running across each other at a strip poker game has to be astronomically low... that can't be what's going on here.
They not only wanted to destroy the Sinnoh region, but the entire world. Thank goodness I managed to close the portal before things got worst.
Long story short, they opened a portal to another dimension, and I had to venture inside to convince the Legendary Pokémon living inside to close it.
Long story short, they enslaved two Legendary Pokémon to create a new universe, but I managed to break the chains they were using, closing off the portal to the other universe.
I still remember when Alder tried to ask me out to a date. I wouldn't mind if you did the same, ~name~.
It felt very creepy when Alder would flirt with me, but I don't see anything wrong with you flirting with me.
I don't know if you eat out alone all the time like Alder, but I can fix that problem if that is the case.
Juri? This is no time to be fooling around...
Ha! What's wrong, Florina? Can't take the heat?
Ha! Can't take the heat, Florina? I figured someone would try to bail on me.
Ha! What's the matter, Florina? Chickening out? Heh; I figured there'd be some who weren't up to my challenge!
What's the matter, scared? Heh; your instinct to flee doesn't surprise me.
What's the matter, scared? Don't worry, most challengers who face me get the instinct to flee.
I don't like the look of her, Jura. I would take her threats seriously if I were you. I've seen enough of magic users to know an untrustworthy one.
Oh, this is the perfect time to ask you some questions, Pit! Who is Hades? Is he an important mythological figure in Skyworld?
Oh, this is the perfect time to ask you some questions, Pit! Who is Hades? Is he a figure in the folklore of Skyworld?
This might be a good time to ask you some questions, Pit! Can you tell me a little bit about this Hades?
Oh, Pit, you might prove useful for my research! Can you tell me more about this Hades? What is he like?
Oh, Pit, you might prove useful for my research! Can you tell me more about this Hades? What is his importance to Skyworld?
Come on, Tharja, let's let the angel do his thing.
Horseplay? During our game? ... Can't we be just a little serious?
Well, yes, Pit... My inquisitive demeanor aside, I joined tonight's game to see some guys show some skin.
Well, to be honest, Pit, seeing some naked men is... it's precisely why I joined tonight's game.
Well, yes, Pit... My inquisitive demeanor aside, I joined today's game to see some guys show some skin.
Well, to be honest, Pit, seeing some naked men is... it's precisely why I joined today's game.
What, is that so hard to imagine, Pit? You're a bit short to be my type, but a topless guy is still a topless guy!
Come on, Pit, is that so hard to imagine? Just like I'm sure you want to see me topless, I want to see you topless; it's the reason we're here, after all.
Oh, we do celebrate Valentine's day here, Meia, and we also use Cupid as a symbol... But Cupid originated from the Pokémon Clefable, right? Does your space fleet have native Clefables?
This is a misunderstanding, Meia. Valentine's and Cupid are also tradition just like in your space fleet, but I'm baffled that you didn't know what Clefable is, as it inspired Cupid's design.

Oh right. Pokémon are these creatures that live symbiotically with humans. Humans take care of them, and in return, they help assist in everyday life. They commonly have powers, such as elemental, and psychic.

Pokémon are creatures that have coexisted with humans since recorded history. Humans feed and groom them, and they usually serve as companions. Most of them have fantastical powers such as water, fire, earth, and even psychic.
Why, those shoes are pretty cute, Elesa!
Now those are what I call headphones!
Those are rather cute! It's the little things that really pull an outfit together.
You certainly put a lot of effort into every last detail of your outfit! I just... stick to black.
I would suppose it would get lonely up there in space, and holding costume parties would be a good way of coping with the feeling of isolation.
Perhaps, this is a emotional defense mechanism for dealing with the feeling of insignificance within the vastness of space.
You're right, Pit, it's not so bad right now; we could both be doing much worse...
You're right, Pit, it's not so bad right now; we're a little ways in and you're only now taking off your first item!
You're right, Pit, it's not so bad right now; taking off your first layer this far into the game isn't easy.
What's the matter, are you embarrassed? I don't think the boys here will judge you.
What's the matter, are you embarrassed? I don't think ~male~ will judge you.
What's the matter, are you embarrassed? Come on, let loose a little; we're all women here!
What, are you embarrassed or something? It's just us girls here.
Oh? Have you been through a lot of firefights with it?
You've been through that much, huh? How many firefights does that include?
First your armbands, and now your sash? Can you not dress yourself, Pit?
First your armbands, and now your sash? How complicated is your uniform, Pit?
You're struggling with your sash too? Pit, how do you get dressed in the morning?
You're struggling with you sash now too? Come on, Pit, you're uniform couldn't be that complicated.
You said you were struggling with your armbands as well, Pit... What's so difficult about taking off your clothing?
You said you were struggling with your armbands as well, Pit... How can this be that complicated?
You said you were struggling with your armbands as well, Pit... I guess I never realized there would be a technical barrier to this game.
Ha, that makes one of us, Pit!
Hee hee, and I hope they do, Pit!
Oh? And what if they do, Pit?
Oh? And what if they do fall down? Then what, Pit?
You say that like having them fall down is a bad thing, Pit.
You say that like having them fall down is a bad thing, Pit; I was kind of hoping they would fall down!
Oh, really? Have you had it for that long?
Oh? You need to tell me all about it, Pit! What have you gone through with that sash?
Oh? What have you been through with that sash? Tell me all the details!
Oh, are you struggling? I can help out if you need me too!
Will your sash not come off? I can help you with that!
Is it stuck? If you want, I can help you!
Oh, like a Magnezone? Yeah, yeah I can see it...
Why, I suppose they do remind me of Magnezones...
I've seen some Magnezones at Mt. Coronet, and you're right! Those do resemble a Magnezone.
Oh? Are you embarrassed about your taste in music?
No, in fact, I am not jealous, Guzma. For all I know, you've stolen those as well! Hell, you're entire outfit could be stolen...
Get a grip, Guzma; I've helped out homeless folks with better-looking shoes...
Get a grip, Guzma; I've encountered seasoned hikers with shoes in better condition...
Please, Guzma; my grandmother in Celestic Town has shoes more stylish than those...
Ha, as if, Guzma; I wouldn't be caught dead in shoes like those.
Don't be so foolish, Guzma; my heels are much more suitable for me than those.
Your sandals? Are those some sort of special angel sandals, or are they what I would be familiar with here on Earth?
Oh, are those... Do those sandals have some sort of heavenly powers in them? What makes them different from regular footwear? I must study them...
Oh, sandals from the heavens? I have to ask: is there anything special about those?
Those sandals... What kind of shoemaker made those? Is shoemaking a well-respected profession in Skyworld?
Well, if they're worn down, would you mind if I keep them, Pit? I think an angel's sandals would make a fascinating addition to my personal collection of mythological artifacts!
Well, if they're worn down, would you mind if I keep them, Pit? I could make important advancements in the field of mythology if only I could study those...
How do your sandals get so worn down, Pit? Don't angels usually... fly everywhere?
Oh, so they do have socks in Skyworld? I would have thought angels only used sandals for navigating tough terrain, but otherwise had no need for footwear.
Why don't you wear socks, Pit? Isn't it rather cold up in Skyworld?
Oh, so you do have socks up in Skyworld... Are crew cut socks more popular, or do angels prefer something more low cut?
Embarrassingly enough, I can't recall what your moniker is, Elesa.
They call you... the Shining Star, right? Elesa the... Shining Star, was it?
I think you're the Eternal Beauty, right?... No, that doesn't seem right.
Oh, so you keep in shape? Does flying burn off a lot of calories or something?
Oh, so you keep in shape then, Pit? Does Lady Palutena feed you healthy, then?
Oh, is she in charge of your fitness regimen, Pit? Are angels normally out of shape or something?
Speaking of fitness, Pit, what kinds of proteins do you eat? What fruits grow in Skyworld? I'm trying to build a picture... for my research, of course.
Oh, Wii Fit Trainer? Did you meet her in Smash, or does she frequent Skyworld?
Oh, Wii Fit Trainer? Did you meet her in Smash?
So you keep in shape then, Pit? What does the diet of a typical angel look like? Understanding this might prove vital in my research.
Oh, you're just gonna throw the game now, Pit? Why, I would have enjoyed a challenge...
Ha, you're going to short yourself a layer, Pit? Well, I at least appreciate your eagerness to show me something nice.
Really, a hassle? Do they not have clasps or something?
Oh, why I can help out if you need me to, Pit.
If you're having trouble, Pit, I could lend a hand!
Why, those don't look that tricky, Pit... Don't you just undo the clasps?
Why, those don't look that tricky, Pit... Aren't there just clasps you have to undo?
Ha, I don't doubt that, Pit; accessories usually require the most work to take on and off.
Ha, I know the feeling! You wouldn't believe how difficult it is to get these things in my hair.
A firefight? You mean... Like an Infernape?
A firefight? You mean... Like a Blaziken?
A firefight? Like... a fire and fighting type?
Oh, a firefight! Pit, I had no idea you put your life on the line for Skyworld...
Oh, Pit, I had no idea you engaged in firefights; why, aren't you a trooper!
A firefight? Heavens, Pit, I had no idea you did such things.
A... Menger Sponge? Is that like a Pokémon from Unova?
A... Menger Sponge? Is... Is that a Pokémon I'm not familiar with?
A... Menger Sponge? Is that like a Pokémon from your homeland?
Menger... Sponge? Is that a Pokémon? I've never heard of a sponge Pokémon before?
Menger Sponge! Y-eah, I know that Pokémon, totally! I wouldn't be the Sinnoh League champion if I didn't know about the Mengers Sponge.
Ha! I like the way you think, N! We're all trying to win first and foremost; must give ourselves every advantage possible while staying within the rules.
Ha! I like the way you think, N; I had thought you a villain before, but clearly you've more honor that I expected.
Yep! Those are the rules, N!
You would be correct, N.
How astute, N!
Yes, N. That's why it's called strip poker!
Ahhh, Red; now there's a name I haven't heard in a while. I wonder if he's finally ready for a rematch!
Red; now there's a name I haven't heard in a long while. I wonder how he's doing these days...
Ah, Red; now there's a name I haven't heard in while... We go way back, you see, and we've both studied alongside under Professor Oak.
Ah, your swag. Tell me, did you steal that from a jewelry store, or some poor girl?
Detective Looker will be happy to confiscate your swag for you once you've been apprehended.
Your bracelets? If you've stolen those from a jewelry store, Detective Looker will find out about it and you will pay for your crimes!
Ah, your swag. Tell me, did you steal that from a jewelry store, or some poor teenager?
Ha, custom-made? Don't lie to me; you stole those, didn't you...
That's ridiculous; you got a professional to make those glasses just for you and still turned out like that?
Ha, custom-made? I bet you stole those from a thrift store...
Be serious, you stole those, didn't you? Or did you have your grunts do it for you.
Ha, "not so bad"... That's easy for you to say, Pit.
Huh? Oh, right... I suppose someone still one their first item would say something like that...
That's easy for you to say, Pit!
That's easy for you to say, Pit! Some of us are about to... expose ourselves...
Oh, do you feel tough, Pit? Some of us are, er... doing much worse...
Pit... I'm already showing cleavage, how is it "not so bad"?
Pit... I'm... I'm indecent
Surely you don't expect me to agree with you, do you Pit?
Pit... I'm already exposing some cleavage, this is certainlybad...
Pit... Really? How bold of you to say that...
Pit? ... You really are clueless, aren't you?
It seems books aren't the only thing you can't read, Pit... Social cues could be added to that list...
I know you can't read books, Pit, but I would have at least thought you could read social cues...
Really Pit? ... Not bad? Just... just shut up, okay?
Perhaps I should have introduced my grandma first. She's the Head of the Celestic Town Historical Research Center, and she'd probably advocate for the preservation of abandoned colonies.
Oh, right, I need to introduce grandma first. She's one of the most well-respected archaeologists and historians in the Sinnoh , and she'd be ecstatic to preserve the colonies for future study.
Grandma is also an archaeologist and historian, and the main reason why I took up interest as well. Knowing her, I bet she'd request for the old colonies to become heritage sites.
I suppose that could be the case. I'm just surprised that I can't really remember women being mentioned much in regards to space travel, but perhaps I should read more.
It might be my lack of knowledge in that area of history, but I don't seem to recall any names of female space travelers. At the very least, they're more obscure than their male counterparts.
You called yourself a pirate, Meia? Like a maritime pirate, but in space? History really is repeating itself... In any case, I have Garchomp with me, so don't even consider robbing me.
You're a pirate, Meia?! All this time I've been keeping my guard down! Well, if your intention was to rob all of us, then my Garchomp will have some business with you.
Did you just say you're a pirate, Meia? Regardless, I have Garchomp to protect me if anything unsavory happens here, so I would suggest against... whatever you're planning.
At the very least, it's a more desirable way of relieving stress than shooting anything with your guns. Less noisy as well.
I don't know what your intention is with your guns, but it's good that you're not using them as a way of releasing your anger.

Well, that would explain it. She has that fiery competitiveness as well, but she's not the type to hurl death threats to other people. Besides, being your younger sister would probably have stunted her growth.

I figured as much. She's pretty genteel for someone from Southeastern Unova, not like you at all. Not to mention she probably would have developed differently if she had you for a sister during her formative years.
Fascinating. And have you noticed if your crew have picked up some of your traditional cultures and vice versa?
I see. Do you and your crew celebrate each other's holidays and traditions?
Indeed, with that much diversity among our crew, you bound to pickup up each other's traditions. Am I correct in that assumption?

condition.saying: cause trouble for the rest of us

case.state: I am aware that cartography was a common pastime among sailors. But, you mentioned a friend of yours, Nami. What's his condition?
Yes, that corroborates my findings that map-making was how seamen keep themselves occupied. But you mentioned that your friend has an issue of sorts. Can you elaborate on that?
That does explain the abundance of naval maps in the museum. By the way, what is your friend going through, Nami? You mentioned that something was wrong with him.
You're not that kind of pirate... Oh, you must be one of those government-employed privateers then, tasked with attacking the ships of other nations.

If you don't attack innocent ships, then you must be a privateer then. It must be interesting being employed by the government to attack other nation's ships without actually being part of the naval power.
... What type of crisis could cause such a large-scale evacuation?
... There has to be more to the story than that. That many people cannot be displaced so easily.
Oh... Well, that's more of a reason to not trust you then. If you think this would be an easy job for you, then you would be badly mistaken.
This game might end in a violent manner, and I wouldn't be so sure that you would come out on top if I were you.
Thanks for informing ahead of time. Usually, assassins like you don't warn people, but it's good that you did, so that I won't get caught out by surprise.
I'm not sure if this is another bluff, but it would be a good idea to keep in mind that I won't let you get away easily should you try anything violent around here.
Oh, I see... Moving to Earth, wouldn't be out of question, would it? You can do a good job of blending in here as long as you don't pirate ships.
Since you're already here and you've not been attacked yet, perhaps Earth can be the site of your crew's relocation instead. You look very much an Earth human still.
If you don't have any other options, you should consider moving back to Earth. It doesn't look like you will have too much difficulty getting used to the way of living here.
... You're definitely not a Hex Maniac, then... I was just wondering because you greatly resembled their average member...
... Oh, it was just an honest mistake... I mentioned it because I was very sure you were a Hex Maniac. The resemblance was just too uncanny to ignore.
That does make sense, Jura... Say, how often are you piloting ships? Is it a regular thing that you do?
Well, that explains a lot... But I do wonder if you have to wear your spacesuits often. Is piloting just something you expect to do on a daily basis?

condition.saying: If I were to venture a guess: divine influence

case.state: Hold on, was that serious, Galatea? Under what manner does an ancient marble statue gain sentience and animation?
It couldn't possibly be... but it has, in front of my own eyes... But I don't understand... how does marble begat a living and talking statue?
Of course! Natural pregnancy would be a notable event in a planet with no men!... That does beg the question of how you maintained your population without men.
A planet with no men is a planet with no pregnancy... Why didn't I think of that?... If you had no men to impregnate your population, how has your planet not died out yet?
Oh, pardon me then, Neptune. It's just that ghost-type trainers have a very similar sense of fashion as you. Very easy mistake to make.
Well, I should have known better than jumping to conclusions based on appearances. That assumption is correct most of the time, but still...

Emerging from a portal, and having the codename "Supernova"... there are no doubts in my mind you're a member of Team Galactic. You might not be in your uniform, but you weren't going to fool me that easily!
Oh, give it up! That little performance isn't enough to sway me, "Supernova". Based on your choice of alias and previous actions, I have already figured out that you're a Team Galactic grunt.

Arceus gave you life... while you were still being carved by your artist? How bizarre... I have read stories of Arceus punishing those who betrayed it... Perhaps you did so, in another life, and this was your punishment.

It almost sounds like Arceus was torturing you by putting you on that fate... Perhaps that was the exact intention. You might have wronged Arceus in your past life, and your punishment was being entombed in a block of marble, and your artist saved you.

Why would Arceus purposely trap you in uncarved marble?... Unless... Yes, it sounds familiar... Arceus does not suffer fools, inflicting agony for perceived wrongs... and for you, the sentence was life as a living block of marble...
Do you mean... you're a real goddess?! A deity living in the mortal world?! I've never heard of an actual goddess that looks like a human before! Which pantheon do you even belong to?
It can't be! An actual living goddess standing in front of me! Especially one that looks so human-like! I don't recall reading about you in any of the pantheons I've studied!

Why? Well, if you were someone who considers emotions to be pitifully useless, illogical and irrational, and all sentimentality to be vacuous, then this plan makes perfect sense from your point of view.

Are you really going to make me explain? If you are of the mindset that emotions are mere illusion, and you've abandoned all forms of emotions as useless sentimentality, then this would the logical conclusion.
Well, if you're an actual goddess, and not just another delusional Team Galactic grunt, prove it.

A real goddess would have the power to prove their status as a deity. Well then, the burden of proof lies on you, and the only way you can prove you're not a Team Galactic member is to show me your powers.
You must have been quite busy, if you couldn't find the time to ride your bike recently. What have you been up to?
I'm assuming that you meant that you've been rather preoccupied, hence you were not able to go biking recently, Jim. Would you mind sharing what you've been busy with?
Really?... And what sort of event are you referring to, Chara?
Are you alluding to some event in particular, Chara? I'll be interested in hearing about it, if you don't mind.
I'm all ears if you're planning to tell a story, Chara.

If you're still curious, a Toucannon is a flying-type Pokémon native to Alola. Like your outfit, it is full of dark feathers with red embellishments. If you've eaten Froot Loops, you would have seen a Toucannon mascot on the box.

You're not familiar with Alolan Pokémon, Laevatein? Anyway, Toucannon is a flying-type winged Pokémon, and your outfit reminded me of its black feathers with a red tail. The box mascot of Froot Loops is a Toucannon, if you've seen one.
Nevada? I've never heard of such a place before, but judging from your earlier descriptions, it seems to be a place torn by violence. What happened to cause that current situation?
I'm not familiar with this "Nevada", but it seems to be experiencing war right now, if my inference is correct. Do you know what caused it to descend to that condition?

I was trying to learn the sacrificial rituals of an ancient kingdom, Jason. By learning more about that kingdom's pantheon, I can perhaps decipher their creation story, and contrast them with the creation stories of surrounding regions.

I was there to learn more about their sacrificial rituals, and how it ties up with their creation story. They were not the only kingdom to do such sacrifices, so I was hoping to see if they have the same origins as the others.
A big... mouth?! I don't have a big mouth, do I?!
And what was that supposed to mean?!
I... I don't know either. I've never been one for unhealthy diet.
Maybe... I wouldn't know. I don't think I've ever indulged in an unhealthy diet.
... And what exactly is your reason for abandoning the... previous organization you were working for?
... Something must have caused you to switch allegiances, because I doubt you would have done simply of your own accord... What is it?
When you say "monsters", what precisely are you referring to? And how are you sure you and ~player~ didn't kill anyone beyond that?
I need some clarification on what you are referring to as a "monster", and if you're sure that you didn't kill anyone else beyond these "monsters"...

That's how they always begin: things will look better in the short-term, only for things to take a turn for the worse once the government begins to crave power, continuing the cycle. Oh, sorry, that was a bit cynical.
